short_message: In a quite bizarre and shocking decision, the Union Government has awarded Institute of Eminence status to six institutions which don't include IIT Kharagpur
message:
In a quite bizarre and shocking decision, the Union Government has awarded Institute of Eminence status to six institutions which don't include IIT Kharagpur and few other old IITs. Jio Institute by Reliance Foundation, Manipal Academy of Higher Education and BITS Pilani are the three private universities awarded this status whereas IIT Bombay, IIT Delhi and IISc Bengaluru are the government institutions bestowed with this status. The surprise entry was Jio Institute which has not even started functioning and is reportedly set to begin operations in next three years.
The decision is aimed at improving the global rankings of Indian Universities since none of the Indian Institutions has a place in the top 200 in world rankings. All the six Institutes of Eminence will enjoy complete academic and administrative autonomy to start a new course, hire foreign faculties and collaborate with foreign institutes without government approval. The three public sector institutes will be given a grant of thousand crore rupees in the next five years. The MHRD had earlier aimed to select 20 Institutes of Eminence – 10 public and 10 private, which will enjoy complete autonomy. But the panel headed by former Election Commissioner N. Gopalaswami found only six to be fit despite almost all IITs applied for the coveted tag.

Source: https://www.thehindu.com/...

short_message: The Kharagpur RoboSoccer Students' Group (KRSSG) secured the 2nd position in the Goalie skills Challenge of the 3D Soccer Simulation League at RoboCup
message:
The Kharagpur RoboSoccer Students' Group (KRSSG) secured the 2nd position in the Goalie skills Challenge of the 3D Soccer Simulation League at RoboCup 2018, held in Montreal, Canada from June 15 to June 22, 2018. They competed against 6 other teams consisting of postgraduates and professors across Germany, USA, Portugal, Brazil and China, making a total of 7 teams that participated in the competition.
The league comprised of simulating Naobots via computer systems connected a server. Each Naobot had to access the situation of the field and the optimum strategy to use itself, which makes it a decentralised AI system. Two undergraduates, Shubhanan Shriniket and Pratik Tibrewal represented the team in this competition.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire KRSSG team for their success and all the laurels that they have brought to KGP!

short_message: New semester's about to begin; new aspirations tending to spur into the veins of KGPians and monsoon's here too! What we require now is the ignition to
message:
New semester's about to begin; new aspirations tending to spur into the veins of KGPians and monsoon's here too! What we require now is the ignition to kick-off this enthusiastic journey. How about a start with the FIFA WC'18?
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur, in association with the Wackers and Conferencia, presents to you the opportunity to catch the live action as top teams fight for the World Cup glory! The premises of the Technology Students' Gymkhana will be all set to invite you to a thrilling stadium-like experience as the heart-stopping matches would be streamed live on the 12 feet x 8 feet LED screen. We thank Prof. William Mohanty, President, and Mr. Vishal Kumar Singh, Vice President, Technology Students' Gymkhana, to grant us the permission to organise this Mega-Event. We also thank the sponsor, the Wacker, to make this initiative of our's a reality. Our success, however, depends on whether our motive for this event is fulfilled and that being the enjoyment of the entire community of IIT Kharagpur.
So gear up your enthusiasm, gather your squad and grab your boots to catch the thrilling FIFA WC'18 action, live at the premises of Technology Students' Gymkhana.
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur, hopes for the well being of each and everyone as well as wishes the best for the upcoming session.

short_message:
साहित्य के सितारे ।। बाबा नागार्जुन

Native Maithili speaker Baba Nagarjun was one of the most fearless Hindi poets that stepped up in the modern
message:
साहित्य के सितारे ।। बाबा नागार्जुन

Native Maithili speaker Baba Nagarjun was one of the most fearless Hindi poets that stepped up in the modern era. Often referred to as “Jankavi” or poet of the masses, many regard him next to only Tulsidas and Kabir when it comes to expressing mass sentiments bluntly.

Travelling shaped up his early writings as he wrote with a pen name of “Yatri” or traveller and “बादल को घिरते देखा है” a travelling monologue, is one of his finest works in this dimension. The other dimension that shaped up most of his literature was socio-political activism. He was highly impressed by Marxism and led peasants movements in Bihar. “आओ रानी, हम ढोयेंगे पालकी” is a sarcastic masterpiece that humiliates Pandit Nehru’s lavish welcome thrown to the British queen. Nagarjun played an active role in movements prior to the Emergency period in 1975-77 and masses hailed his views that were mostly rebellious of those in power.

“बन्दूकें ही हुईं आज माध्यम शासन का
गोली ही पर्याय बन गई है राशन का”
-मोर न होगा...उल्लू होंगे

Nagarjun was given the Sahitya Akademi Award in 1969 for his historic book Patarheen Nagna Gachh, and the 'Bharat Bharati Award' by the Uttar Pradesh government for his literary contributions in 1983. In times when the tendency to flow with the mainstream overhauls, Nagarjun’s defiant clarity serves as an inspiration to speak out loud for the downtrodden and opens us up to the stark realities of life.

short_message: There were few concerns and speculations among the student community after the announcement of secure WiFi login through ERP. Speculations included daily/weekly
message:
There were few concerns and speculations among the student community after the announcement of secure WiFi login through ERP. Speculations included daily/weekly limit on data usage, attempt to track down the nature of data usage etc. We contacted Head (CIC) over these speculations and found out that none of these are true.
As per Head (CIC), there is no change in usage policy in terms of data limit and time of usage. It would be same as it has been till now. Currently, it will just require you to authenticate into the Wi-Fi network so that only valid users are allowed to use it. However, there will be a limit on the no. of devices connected at any one point of time from a single user id so that the user id is not misused. The limit will be reasonable given that a student may have multiple devices like laptop, 1-2 phones etc., and there will be this device limit for all including faculty and staff, not just students. Right now, CIC has enabled the authentication so that the IIT community starts using it and they will consider the feedbacks before they finally make the entire Wi-Fi access authenticated. This is why they have not turned off the non-authenticated SSIDs now. They will give sufficient notice to the entire IIT community before the whole Wi-Fi becomes authenticated.
As for the concerns over tracking down the nature of data usage, he said that the IIT network is for everyone's academic and reasonable personal use only. CIC does not track the nature of data usage and this authentication process does not change that policy, but users should not indulge in misusing the Wi-Fi network for illegitimate purposes. A general guideline of usage can be found in the Policies link of www.cic.iitkgp.ac.in .

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur encourages the students on campus to start using this authentication and report problems to CIC and provide them with feedbacks.

short_message:
Here's an important update regarding Wi-Fi facility on the campus.
Wi-Fi access inside IIT Kharagpur is soon going to require user authentication.
message:
Here's an important update regarding Wi-Fi facility on the campus.
Wi-Fi access inside IIT Kharagpur is soon going to require user authentication. In order to test the system and allow for a smooth migration, CIC has now enabled three secured SSIDs, ACADEMIC_SECURED, STUDENT_SECURED, CAMPUS_SECURED.

Any user should be able to see one or more of these wherever you may be in the campus. Users are requested to start connecting to the secured SSIDs following the procedure below to access the wi-fi network.

1. Your user id is your ERP login.

2. To create your network access password, log in to your ERP account, and follow the link 'Set Campus Network Password' under the link for 'Home'. Set a password you will use for network access (should be different from your ERP password). You can change the password anytime again in the same manner.

3. Configure your device for wi-fi authentication. Step by step instructions for different OS (Android/Windows/Linux/Mac) can be found in the 'Wi-Fi Authentication' link in http://www.cic.iitkgp.ac.... . Normally, you will have to do this configuration only once per secured SSID unless you change your password or want to login with some other user id.

4. Connect to the corresponding SSID.

Please note the following:

1. Normally, you may need 10-15 seconds for connection the first time you configure, please be patient.

2. Faculty/Staff may share their password with their family members for wi-fi access. However, in order to avoid password misuse, there will be a limit for no. of simultaneous connections. Please note that the user with the user id is responsible for any misuse of the wi-fi network when connected with the user id.

Note that for now the current non-secured SSIDs will stay open until further notice for wi-fi access by people with no ERP account such as guests, visitors, contractual staff needing access for their work etc. The policies for these classes of users and access methods will be circulated soon by CIC.

However, users with ERP accounts are strongly advised to start using the secured SSIDs immediately and report any problems to CIC; the non-secured SSIDs will be withdrawn soon.

-CIC Support Team

short_message: Yoga, an ancestral art, is the treasure for the humanity to rejoice with its overarching benefits. The significance of Yoga is well-described in ancient
message:
Yoga, an ancestral art, is the treasure for the humanity to rejoice with its overarching benefits. The significance of Yoga is well-described in ancient scriptures along with the Shrimad Bhagavad Gita. Rather than being merely physical exercise, It is one of the most favourable paths to establish a deep connection between one’s body, soul, and nature. Not to mention, the practice of Yoga imparts physical, mental and emotional health in one’s life.

United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) declared the International Yoga Day to be celebrated on 21st June which is also marked as the summer solstice, after being proposed by our Prime Minister, Mr. Narendra Modi. Since 2015, it has been celebrated in India and worldwide with great enthusiasm.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes you all a healthy and happy International Yoga Day!

short_message: We all learn a lot from our fathers. He is the person who introduces us to this world with the struggles and teaches to overcome the obstacles. A father
message: We all learn a lot from our fathers. He is the person who introduces us to this world with the struggles and teaches to overcome the obstacles. A father may seem to be tough from the external appearance, but he knows exactly when to come to his child's rescue building perfectly the strength and fighting spirit of his child. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes a very Happy Father's Day to all the artists who skillfully shape up their children and give them the endurance to stand against the blows of life.

short_message: As Eid-ul-Fitr marks the end of the soul-purifying month of charity and prayers-the month of Ramzan, let us all stand for love and sympathy in an era troubled
message:
As Eid-ul-Fitr marks the end of the soul-purifying month of charity and prayers-the month of Ramzan, let us all stand for love and sympathy in an era troubled with hatred. While Offering of 'Namaz' and charity to the poor symbolize this auspicious occasion of goodwill, the delicious dishes and warm hugs mark the joyful celebration!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes Eid Mubarak to one an all and hopes that our lives are blessed with the message of peace and brotherhood.

short_message: About a month is left for a new academic session when we all will be welcoming a new batch of freshers in our campus. It becomes important that we smoothen
message: About a month is left for a new academic session when we all will be welcoming a new batch of freshers in our campus. It becomes important that we smoothen the process of this transitional phase in their lives so that they become acquainted with the type of culture and opportunities available to them. Keeping this in mind, an Induction Programme was organized last year for the first time to ease the process of inducting freshers. Although it was a good initiative, in the end, it received mixed reactions from the freshers. To answer questions about the need for an Induction Programme, the origin of the idea, execution of the plan and it's effectiveness we present to you an analysis of the programme conducted last year. The analysis also includes feedback from freshers on various activities and a brief interaction with Prof. Priyadarshi Patnaik, (HOD, HSS Department) who was actively involved in the conduction of this Programme. The link to the article is: http://awaaziitkgp.org/in...

short_message: This is to notify the students' community that the domain of the ERP system of IIT Kharagpur has been shifted from *.iitkgp.ernet.in to *.iitkgp.ac.in.
message:
This is to notify the students' community that the domain of the ERP system of IIT Kharagpur has been shifted from *.iitkgp.ernet.in to *.iitkgp.ac.in. The ERP can now be accessed at https://erp.iitkgp.ac.in .
This comes after the domain name *.iitkgp.ac.in being verified by Entrust for using SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) for encrypting data between the browser and the website of the institute.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
short_message: QS world ranking for the year 2019 has been released. In what may be inferred as an optimistic sign for IIT-KGP, there has been a slight surge in its ranking
message:
QS world ranking for the year 2019 has been released. In what may be inferred as an optimistic sign for IIT-KGP, there has been a slight surge in its ranking as it has moved up 13 places to 295 as compared to previous year's rank of 308.

With a QS World rank of 162, IIT Bombay has surpassed previous year's leader IIT Delhi as the top Ranked Indian college. Amongst the other top Ranked Indian colleges, IISc Bangalore has made a 20-place jump to a rank of 170 while IIT Delhi and IIT Madras have maintained their ranks of 172 and 264 respectively. Most of the experts have deemed improvement in research output as the prime factor for better QS rankings of top-ranked Indian institutes.

QS (Quacquarelli Symonds Limited) world rankings are one of the most widely read academic rankings, released every year based on scores of six metrics- academic reputation (40%), faculty-student ratio(20%), citations per faculty(20%), employer reputation (10%) and international students, faculty ratio(5% each). Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Stanford University, and Harvard University have retained their 1st, 2nd and 3rd position respectively.

message: We bring to you some glimpses of the ongoing 6th International Convention at IIT Kharagpur, being organised by SPIC MACAY in this ongoing week (3rd - Sat, 9th June 2018). The core purpose behind this is to have every child experience the inspiration and mysticism embodied in Indian and World Heritage. SPIC MACAY (Society for the Promotion of Indian Classical Music And Culture Amongst Youth) is organising programmes of classical music and dance, folk arts, crafts, yoga, classic cinema screenings, heritage walks, etc. in the campus to make people more aware about Indian and world heritage. Have a look:

short_message: World Environment Day, driven by the United Nations Environment Programme to raise global awareness, is an important day to mark the rising environmental
message:
World Environment Day, driven by the United Nations Environment Programme to raise global awareness, is an important day to mark the rising environmental concerns and motivate positive actions to protect our beautiful planet Earth. The theme for the World Environment Day 2018 is “Beat Plastic Pollution”. It urges governments, industries, communities, and individuals to come together and explore sustainable alternatives and urgently reduce the production and excessive use of Single-use Plastic polluting our oceans, damaging the marine life and threatening human health.

India, the host of the year, has pledged to clean up its monuments and reduce the use of plastic disposables around them. If each and every one of us does at least one green good daily towards our Green Social Responsibility, there will be billions of green goods daily on the planet.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appeals to everyone to contribute towards reviving the green diversity of our mother Earth!

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos — with Sanskar Agrawal and 6 others.
short_message: The day couldn't have started on a better note for KGP! The research groups of our institute seem to be on a roll! In what comes as a matter of pride for
message:
The day couldn't have started on a better note for KGP! The research groups of our institute seem to be on a roll! In what comes as a matter of pride for KGP student community and a testimony of brilliance of its research fraternity, Autonomous Ground Vehicle (AGV) research group, IIT Kharagpur have secured second position in 26th International Ground Vehicle Competition (IGVC) held at Oakland University in Rochester, Michigan on June 1 - June 4, 2018.
A total of 43 teams across India, Japan, USA, Canada and Istanbul had registered for this prestigious navigation challenge. But our team gave the best of the colleges which included the likes of University of British Columbia, Georgia Institute of Technology, University of Michigan-Ann Arbor, Ohio University etc., a run for their money. 7 teams from India contested in it including those from IIT Madras and IIT Kanpur. Team AGV finished as Runner-Up, while the winners were the team CART (Center for Applied Research and Technology), Inc. at Bluefield State College, USA.

They needed to make a bot which can follow the lanes avoiding the obstacles by following given GPS coordinates. They designed forward wheel drive bot with castor at back. The one travelling the maximum distance of the given arena would go on to win the competition. Their bot travelled a remarkable 260 feets in the process of finishing as Runner Ups.

The entire AGV team had started assembling and modelling of the bot from December itself and with ample support from Prof. DrDebashish Chakravarty of Mining Engineering Department, their efforts got better and better. As their bot scaled past the obstacles following GPS coordinates, it was in a way metaphoric of the AGV team scaling new heights with their efforts. And a special credit also goes to the first year members who worked relentlessly and contributed with great zeal and enthusiasm.

The Intelligent Ground Vehicle Competition (IGVC) is an annual international robotics competition for teams of undergraduate and graduate students. Teams design and build an autonomous ground vehicle capable of completing several difficult challenges. To know more about AGV, visit: www.agv.iitkgp.ac.in

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team of AGV on this remarkable feat and hopes that the level and quality of research continues to set new standards in the upcoming days.

message:

In what comes as a matter of pride for KGP student community and a testimony of brilliance of its research fraternity, Autonomous Ground Vehicle (AGV) research group, IIT Kharagpur have secured second position in 26th International Ground Vehicle Competition (IGVC) held at Oakland University in Rochester, Michigan on June 1 - June 4, 2018.
A total of 43 teams across India, Japan, USA, Canada and Istanbul had registered for this prestigious navigation challenge. But our team gave the best of the colleges which included the likes of University of British Columbia, Georgia Institute of Technology, University of Michigan-Ann Arbor, Ohio University etc., a run for their money. 7 teams from India contested in it including those from IIT Madras and IIT Kanpur. Team AGV finished as Runner Up, while the winners were the team CART (Center for Applied Research and Technology), Inc. at Bluefield State College, USA.
They needed to make a bot which can follow the lanes avoiding the obstacles by following given GPS coordinates. They designed forward wheel drive bot with castor at back. The one travelling the maximum distance of the given arena would go on to win the competition. Their bot travelled a remarkable 260 feets in the process of finishing as Runner Ups.
The entire AGV team had started assembling and modelling of the bot from December itself and with ample support from Prof. Dr. Debashish Chakravarty of Mining Engineering Department, their efforts got better and better. As their bot scaled past the obstacles following GPS coordinates, it was in a way metaphoric of the AGV team scaling new heights with their efforts. And a special credit also goes to the first year members who worked relentlessly and contributed wth great zeal and enthusiasm.
The Intelligent Ground Vehicle Competition (IGVC) is an annual international robotics competition for teams of undergraduate and graduate students. Teams design and build an autonomous ground vehicle capable of completing several difficult challenges.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team of AGV on this remarkable feat and hopes that the level and quality of research continues to set new standards in the upcoming days.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos.
short_message: The 6th International Convention of SPIC MACAY was inaugurated here at IIT Kharagpur on 3rd June. The convention will go on till June 9 and includes activities
message:
The 6th International Convention of SPIC MACAY was inaugurated here at IIT Kharagpur on 3rd June. The convention will go on till June 9 and includes activities such as Hatha and Naad Yoga, Craft, Classical and Folk Intensives, Gurbani, Qawalli, theatre, Heritage walk and Cultural talks. It is being held in collaboration with the MHRD, Ministry of Culture and Ministry of Tourism, Government of India.
The Society for the Promotion of Indian Classical Music and Culture Amongst Youth (SPIC MACAY) was founded in the year 1977 by Professor Kiran Seth, an alumnus of IIT Kharagpur and also the recipient of its Distinguished Alumnus Award. As the name suggests the organisation aims to promote Indian classical music, dance, folk music, yoga and meditation and other forms of Indian arts and crafts.
The tentative schedule of the convention can be seen here:

short_message: SPIC MACAY is presenting a precious opportunity for KGP students who are currently in the campus to attend their workshop and learn various forms of Music,
message:
SPIC MACAY is presenting a precious opportunity for KGP students who are currently in the campus to attend their workshop and learn various forms of Music, Dance, Yoga, Painting, Pottery and other interesting craft skills.
The workshops in Music includes Rabindra Sangeet, Dhrupad, Hindustani Vocal, Carnatic Vocal, Gurbani, Baul etc. Dance workshops includes Kuchipudi, Kathak, Odissi, Kathakali, Bharatanatyam, Mohiniyattam, Chhau etc. Yoga workshop would feature Hatha Yoga workshop. Other workshops includes sessions on paintings, crafts, pottery, basketry, weaving, mask making, paper cutting and wood carving.

IIT KGP students who want to participate in this workshop and morning yoga sessions are requested to fill this google form and report to control desk in Nalanda Complex tomorrow (5/6/18) morning at 8.30 am. The seats will be filled on first come first serve basis. There is no charge for attending these workshops and yoga sessions.
Kindly don't fill the form if you want to attend the concerts only.

https://docs.google.com/f...

short_message: Advancing one step further in its aim to expand partnership with foreign institutions, IIT Kharagpur has signed agreements with University of Melbourne
message:
Advancing one step further in its aim to expand partnership with foreign institutions, IIT Kharagpur has signed agreements with University of Melbourne and Newcastle for joint study programmes. Full-time Dual Doctoral Programme (DDP) will be rolled out from the semester beginning in July, in collaboration with the University of Melbourne. The MoU with the University of Newcastle is focussed on joint academic and research programmes, joint supervision of doctoral and masters students and other exchange and knowledge sharing initiatives.

Dean of International Relations, Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya said, 'We are delighted that the University of Melbourne, the top-ranked Australian university, will now be our partner in grooming a very select group of doctoral students from our two countries. An industrially advanced nation like Australia and a leading technological university like IIT Kharagpur with its own self-contained campus have a lot to offer to the growing Indian cities as far as infrastructural developments in smart cities are concerned. We are looking forward to working on a project wherein we can develop a model for Indian smart cities.'

Source: https://www.business-stan...

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos.
short_message: Government survey carried out in 2016 shows that every fifteen minutes, a child becomes a victim of sexual abuse in our country. However, the volunteers
message:
Government survey carried out in 2016 shows that every fifteen minutes, a child becomes a victim of sexual abuse in our country. However, the volunteers of the IIT Kharagpur chapter of child rights organization - Child Rights and You (CRY) IIT Kharagpur Volunteer Chapter are bound to contribute to a change in the bigger picture.

Under project 'Balrakshak', initiated in September 2016, 29 workshops have been carried out till date across eight schools of Kharagpur. These workshops are aimed at making the children aware of the danger of sexual abuse and the results too, have been optimistic. Many children and parents have found and raised their voice against the prevalent social evil.

For the first time, 'Baalrakshak' workshop was carried out with the support of police administration.Mr. Alok Rajoria (S.P., Paschim Medinipur) and Mr. Y. Raghuvamsi (A.S.P., Kharagpur) extended their support and assured giving legal help. This latest workshop of this project was carried out on 20th May in Kharagpur Mission Living School(Bangla medium), Digra which witnessed an active participation of around 100 children and 25 parents.

We congratulate the volunteers of CRY, IIT Kharagpur for this step and wish them all the best for more such initiatives in the future that would underline responsibilities of students towards social welfare.

short_message: Vision India Foundation is inviting applications and nominations for the third edition of  ​​World Governance Expedition (WGE), ​ ​an international travel
message:
Vision India Foundation is inviting applications and nominations for the third edition of ​​World Governance Expedition (WGE), ​ ​an international travel program to study best governance practices across the world, ​being organized in partnership with the Embassy of Israel​, on​ October 13-19, 2018. The applications are open until June 3, 2018. For application and more information, interested ones can visit- http:// visionindiafoundation.com... /wge/selection-process/

For nomination, one can visit- http://visionindiafoundat...

In case of any further query, an email can be sent to wge@visionindiafoundation.com.

short_message: Prof. G. P. Rajasekhar, Professor, Department of Mathematics has been selected for the award of 'Mathematician of the Year - 2018' instituted at NIT Warangal.
message:
Prof. G. P. Rajasekhar, Professor, Department of Mathematics has been selected for the award of 'Mathematician of the Year - 2018' instituted at NIT Warangal. He joined the institute in 2000 and currently also holds the position of Chairman, Career Development Centre. His research areas include Boundary integral methods for viscous flows, Hydrodynamic and thermocapillary study of viscous drops, Applications of binary mixture theory to biological tissues.

Prof. Rajasekhar has already been a recipient of many prestigious awards and honors which includes Alexander Von Humboldt Fellowship for Experienced Researchers by Alexander Von Humboldt Foundation, Germany (2008), Royal Society (United Kingdom) - INSA Visiting Scientist (2004), INSA (Indian National Science Academy) Young Scientist Award in Mathematical Sciences (2002), Japan Society for The Promotion of Science (JSPS) Fellowship (1998).

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates our professor and wishes him all the best for his future endeavours!

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 11 new photos.
short_message:
Child Rights and You (CRY) IIT Kharagpur Volunteer Chapter
Volunteers at Child Rights and You (CRY) IIT Kharagpur Volunteer Chapter have been conducting
message:
Child Rights and You (CRY) IIT Kharagpur Volunteer Chapter
Volunteers at Child Rights and You (CRY) IIT Kharagpur Volunteer Chapter have been conducting child sexual abuse awareness cum workshops in schools under the project titled Baalrakshak. A total of 28 workshops, including separate ones for children and parents, have been conducted till now.
One of the workshops that they had conducted, (on 28th of April) has been covered and appreciated by national media as well.
Recently (on 20th of May) another workshop of a similar kind was conducted which was supported by the police administration. The police had promised support for all upcoming programs and also gave away chocolates to the children as a token of love.
Raising sexual awareness included teaching a large number of students the difference between good touch and bad touch. Students of class VI and VII were given self-defence classes too.
Incidents of late have iterated the need for proper sexual education in the country and projects like Baalrakshak will go a long way in serving that need. The Scholars' Avenue appreciates and congratulates CRY for such initiatives and wishes luck for all upcoming events.
Do check out
Child Rights and You (CRY) IIT Kharagpur Volunteer Chapter page for more details and pictures.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos.
short_message: In what comes as a stupendous achievement, Team 'Multi-Storey Surveillance' representing Swarm, IIT Kharagpur has won the 1st Runner-Up position at the
message:
In what comes as a stupendous achievement, Team 'Multi-Storey Surveillance' representing Swarm, IIT Kharagpur has won the 1st Runner-Up position at the national level Robotics competition DRUSE 2018 (DRDO Robotics & Unmanned Systems Exposition), organised by DRDO. They also received a prize of Rupees 1 Lac for implementation of their project in which they had conceptualised and made 7 different robots for various purposes. The final round was held at Defence Institute of Advanced Technology, Pune from 23rd May to 25th May 2018.
The team developed a swarm of heterogeneous swarm robot system, which can map an unknown environment and provide specialised assistance to military or rescue personnel. The system consisted of multiple swarm robots, which was carried by a single carrier robot, each robot having some specialisation of its own, and together they could achieve multiple objectives. Their proposal was to develop a Multi-terrain heterogeneous Swarm System along with a versatile software stack for Surveillance of multi-storey buildings.
The event involved 3-stages, the first one being an idea-submission stage where over 1000 ideas were submitted. Based on that, 30 teams were selected for each of the six regions. Our team stood 2nd at the regional level held at Jadavpur University. From each region, 5 teams were selected, and in the national level, there were 30 teams. Teams had to give live demos for the regional and national round. While the team from MES College (Kerala) emerged as winners, the team from College of Engineering (Pune) finished as 2nd Runner-Up.
The entire Swarm, IIT Kharagpur team gave it their all and were preparing for this competition since November 2017. The enthusiasm shown by first years was also exemplary. The team also gives the credit to Prof. Somesh Kumar for being always helpful with his inputs and also as the PI (Principal Investigator) of the Swarm Robotics group.
DRDO Robotics and Unmanned Systems Exposition (DRUSE) is designed to serve as an open platform to popularize and synergize the national talent in the areas of robotics amongst students for conceptualization, design & development of unmanned systems for defence applications.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire Swarm team for their sparkling performance and wishes them best for their future endeavours. We wish that it would go a long way in serving as a much-needed influx of inspiration to the students involved in various research groups.

story: The Scholars' Avenue added 2 new photos.
short_message: Swarm Robotics IIT Kharagpur took part in DRDO's DRUSE 2018 (DRDO Robotics & Unmanned Systems Exposition) which was held in Pune from 23rd May to 25th
message:
Swarm Robotics IIT Kharagpur took part in DRDO's DRUSE 2018 (DRDO Robotics & Unmanned Systems Exposition) which was held in Pune from 23rd May to 25th May 2018 and won the First Runners Up position to win a cash prize of 1 Lac Rupees for further research and implementation. This was the culmination of the national level challenge which had over 1000 entries out of which 164 qualified for the Zonals on 28th March 2018 where they were crowned the runners-up in the 30 teams selected for the finals.
This team consists of UG Students from various departments and years who work together and had stayed back during the summers to prepare for this competition under the guidance of Prof. Somesh Kumar who is the Professor-in-charge for the project.

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the team for their strong showing and wishes them the best of luck for their future goals.

short_message: As another project under the Science and Heritage Initiative (SandHI) of HRD Ministry, IIT Kharagpur has taken up the Varanasi Urbanism Project to retrace
message:
As another project under the Science and Heritage Initiative (SandHI) of HRD Ministry, IIT Kharagpur has taken up the Varanasi Urbanism Project to retrace Ganga rivers' old routes around which ancient Varanasi thrived and see if they can be brought back to life. These channels have been found to be alive in layers underneath and if activated have the potential to solve the water scarcity and drainage/sewage issues of the hugely populated city. IIT Kgp’s partners are University of Columbia, IIT BHU, and Varanasi Municipal Corporation.

Professor Joy Sen, the HOD of Architecture Department and also the SandHI coordinator of IIT Kharagpur said, 'The city is actually sitting on a well-networked water flow system, which has been unused for centuries. Together with our partner institutions we have devised a plan on how to activate it without disturbing the overground structures much.' The team is routinely sending the PMO draft searches of their research and the Prime Minister is known to have shown his keenness in the project also because it can aid the transformation of Varanasi to a smart city through native wisdom. The Departments of Architecture and Civil Engineering have teamed up for the project.

Source - https://timesofindia.indi...

short_message: IIT Kharagpur has extended support to work in tandem with West Bengal government to boost the 'Kanyashree' project that was rolled out in March 2013 and
message:
IIT Kharagpur has extended support to work in tandem with West Bengal government to boost the 'Kanyashree' project that was rolled out in March 2013 and has also been awarded by the United Nations in June last year. It aims to provide economic assistance for higher studies and contribute to the social upliftment of girls from poor families.

Director Prof. Partha Prathim Chakrabarti believes that availability of all types of books on a single platform, National Digital Library of India (NDLI), can be integrated with the 'Kanyashree' project to provide better inputs. He further insists that IIT Kharagpur is coming up with centers for emerging technologies like Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Internet of Things (IoT) which can be useful in order to improve the quality of learning within the project.

Source- http://www.millenniumpost...

short_message: To make the future engineers more receptive and empathetic towards the society, Nation’s top engineering colleges, the IITs, are adding Music and Dances
message:
To make the future engineers more receptive and empathetic towards the society, Nation’s top engineering colleges, the IITs, are adding Music and Dances along with other Fine arts and Humanistic studies as their core engineering courses. It has been many years since colleges like IIT Madras have been offering integrated MA programmes in Economics and English, while IIT Delhi offers two-year programme and IIT Kharagpur teaches even Law.

IIT Kharagpur is emerging as a center for arts and music for students as well as research scholars. It is focussing more on Indian classical music and musical instruments and has an ongoing collaboration with Pandit Ajoy Chakraborty in this field. Currently, IIT Kharagpur is providing training in music, fine arts, and the performing arts, and also is offering credit courses in the form of electives and micro- specializations. The center will also create national and international outreach programmes for dissemination and collaborative research on science and technology interventions in Indian classical music and arts. IIT Kharagpur intends to begin research on classic musical instruments to bring in innovative materials and processes to optimize cost and time on the making of instruments like sitar and sarod. The main motive behind all this is to create a deeper understanding of social values among the students and preserve the national heritage of the country.

Source: https://economictimes.ind...

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 16 new photos.
short_message: In a quite shocking and startling revelation, it has been found out that a person who has been heavily followed on social media platforms and claimed himself
message:
In a quite shocking and startling revelation, it has been found out that a person who has been heavily followed on social media platforms and claimed himself to be an IIT KGP mechanical graduate everywhere, is not actually a KGPian and he has duped many people of large sums of money including many KGPians. Mr. Niladri Sarkar had claimed himself to pursue MS at Mechanical Engineering Department of IIT KGP and having worked as External Research Associate in the Fluid Dynamics Lab of MIT. He also claimed to be pursuing research at IIT Madras and IIT Bombay at different point of times. A few months ago, when he was in KGP campus, he started approaching faculty members stating that he is an alumnus of IIT KGP and he is willing to collaborate with them for his MIT Project. However, when he was confronted by one of our alumni, Dr. Kaushik Mukherjee on sensing a foul play, he took down most of these claims from social media. Upon contacting the concerned MIT professor, it was also found out that his MIT claim was totally fake. He social engineered his way into IIT KGP. He started adding IITians (and KGPians) to his friend list. Upon seeing a lot of mutual friends, the other students added him. He then approached the junior batches posing himself as an alumnus who was visiting the college on the pretext of meeting some professors and doing research. Many students on the campus got swayed by his claims and his online activities. The students somehow thought of Mr. Niladri Sarkar as a great academician, probably all due to his Quora popularity! And this is why the students were generous enough to lend him money as and whenever he requested. He asked many students for money stating his poor financial conditions and most of them did lend him money which hasn’t been returned yet. The amount that has been taken by him from the students sums up to be a hefty amount.
The following were the claims of Mr. Niladri Sarkar:
1) Mr. Sarkar claims himself to be an IIT KGP student in both his Facebook ( https://www.facebook.com/... ) and Quora ( https://www.quora.com/pro... ) profiles which is false.
2) He pursued MS under the supervision of Prof. P. K. Das, Department of Mechanical Engineering. We confirmed it from the professor and he denied knowing any such student under his guidance.
3) He has an Institute ID card which does not look like the regular ones that we have.
4) He claims to have three research papers none of which are available online since they are done in collaboration with DRDO and AIIMS. These research papers are available within IIT Council, that’s what he has told some people.
5) A mail from Prof. Indranil Manna, Director, IIT Kanpur praising his research works.
6) The Research Quality Index certificate stating that he scored 100/100 in research and obtained an AIR 1. This certificate is claimed to be issued jointly by IIT Kanpur. According to him, this certificate is issued once in five years. However, we weren’t able to find out any such Index or program being organised by any IIT or IISc.
7) Interaction with Prof. S. K. Dash, Head, Department of Mechanical Engineering and other Professors of the department in Nalanda Class Room Complex.
8 ) The offer of direct PhD studentship from Prof. Pradip Dutta, Professor and Chair, Department of Mechanical Engineering, IISc.
9) A mail from Dean MIT expressing their willingness to participate in the Indian Research Quality Index Conference which is going to be organised by him at IIT Kharagpur. No such conference took place in reality.
10) Selection as External Research Associate in Fluid Dynamics Lab of MIT under the supervision of Prof. John Bush. Upon contacting Prof. Bush regarding the validity of the report, the document was found to be fraudulent. Prof. Bush denied having any such student under his supervision
11) A nice conversation with Prof. Souvik Bhattacharyya, Senior Professor and Vice-Chancellor, BITS Pilani.
12) Telephonic interaction with Prof. Amitabha Ghosh, former Director of IIT KGP
13) The evaluation report of MIT Fluid Dynamics Lab.
14) There is also one online article ( https://www.kenfolios.com... ) wherein he was claimed to be KGPian.
Most of these claims have been found false. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur requests all the students to beware of such people including him and do not get swayed by any kind of unauthentic claims. We, as a unit, need to be safe from such elements and take care so that such incidents do not occur. Stay alert, stay cautious! Here’re the relevant pictures including the claims that he has now been taken down.

short_message: Homecoming 2018, a reunion for the batch of 1998, 2003 and 2008, is going to be organized at IIT Kharagpur from 17th to 19th August 2018 by Alumni Cell,
message:
Homecoming 2018, a reunion for the batch of 1998, 2003 and 2008, is going to be organized at IIT Kharagpur from 17th to 19th August 2018 by Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur. The itinerary for the same has been released and can be viewed in the following image. A special and much-anticipated event in this reunion will be the conferment of 1st ever edition of 'Young Alumni Achiever Awards' and also the participants will get a chance to witness the 68th Foundation Day of the Institute where these awards would be conferred.

For registrations and details, please visit: http://alumni.iitkgp.ac.i...

short_message: Homecoming 2018, a reunion for the batch of 1998, 2003 and 2008, is going to be held at IIT Kharagpur from 17th to 19th August 2018. The itinerary for
message:
Homecoming 2018, a reunion for the batch of 1998, 2003 and 2008, is going to be held at IIT Kharagpur from 17th to 19th August 2018. The itinerary for the same has been released and can be viewed in the following image. A special and much-anticipated event in this reunion will be the conferment of 1st ever edition of 'Young Alumni Achiever Awards' and also the participants will get a chance to witness the 68th Foundation Day of the Institute where these awards would be conferred.

For registrations and details, please visit: http://alumni.iitkgp.ac.i...

short_message: Although a fair amount of time has passed since hosting of the Open House with the director in order to discuss the institute's situation and preparedness
message:
Although a fair amount of time has passed since hosting of the Open House with the director in order to discuss the institute's situation and preparedness against any such unfortunate incident in future, a recent notice on the internal notice board caught our attention. The notice which is about the appointment of Council of Dean SA which consists of 10 professors with Dean SA as the chairman. Attached is the notice which bears the date 2nd November 2017 and suggests that the council had been formed within a week of the Open House as announced in the action plan. The council has been formed to assist the dean in his work of looking after the students of the institute.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the council all the best in its future initiatives and endeavours and assures that it will extend its helping hand whenever required.

short_message: A group of twenty LGBTQ students and alumni from IITs have filed a petition in the Supreme Court against the controversial section 377 of Indian Penal
message:
A group of twenty LGBTQ students and alumni from IITs have filed a petition in the Supreme Court against the controversial section 377 of Indian Penal Code(IPC), which criminalises homosexuality and any kind of 'unnatural' sex.

This 20-member group represents an informal pan IIT group Pravritti, comprising over 350 LGBT students, faculty, alumni and staff. The members deem Pravritti as a safe space to interact, connect and network and not an activist group. The petitioners believe that the existing law, which was last upheld in December 2013, is regressive and prevents them from living a life of dignity and has also led to mental trauma and suicidal tendencies in many members.

A series of petitions have been filed over the past few months then and activists believe that this fresh petition by IITians would
add more weight to accelerate what has been a two-decade-old legal battle for rights of LGBT community.

Source: https://thewire.in/lgbtqi...

short_message: Pavan Kumar Maddala, a first year UG student from the Department of Mechanical Engineering is suffering from hearing problem since his childhood. This
message:
Pavan Kumar Maddala, a first year UG student from the Department of Mechanical Engineering is suffering from hearing problem since his childhood. This problem has severely affected his first year at IIT Kgp as he was unable to listen to the lectures. Now, as suggested by the doctors he is in immediate need of a surgery failing to which he could lose his hearing ability forever. This surgery costs INR 10 lakhs. Considering the fact that he belongs to a poor background, the arrangement of this amount needs our immediate help. We urge the student community to come together and help this needy KGPian!

For donation and details please visit- https://www.ketto.org/fun...

short_message: 20 people have been working with a team of lawyers headed by Dr. Menaka Guruswamy to file a writ petition against Section 377 of IPC that is an assault
message:
20 people have been working with a team of lawyers headed by Dr. Menaka Guruswamy to file a writ petition against Section 377 of IPC that is an assault on the right to life with dignity of LGBTQ citizens of India. Their writ petition, on behalf of Pravritti, a group composed of over 350 IIT students and alumni who identify as LGBTQ citizens has been accepted for hearing at the Supreme Court before the CJI bench on expedited track[2]! Find the full press statement and details of the petition here: https://goo.gl/jkcB2i It is expected to be heard along with Navtej Singh Johar v Union of India upcoming in the July session of the court![1] More updates are upcoming especially on how you can get involved! Importantly, you can speak out in favour of LGBTQ rights and help us reach others to increase the force, base and reach of this cause.

Thank you to the team of lawyers, petitioners, LGBTQ supporters and allied friends who worked so hard to pull this through and are working to remove this colonial era blot from our constitution.

One of the members of this group, Keerthana, went live on NDTV 24x7 yesterday. The story can be found here: https://www.ndtv.com/indi...

[1]: http://www.livelaw.in/wan...
[2]: https://twitter.com/india...

Credits: Keerthana's original post: https://www.facebook.com/...

short_message: By now, some of you if not all, must have come to know about a gathering to be held this evening on the recent altercation going on in AMU. In what can
message:
By now, some of you if not all, must have come to know about a gathering to be held this evening on the recent altercation going on in AMU. In what can be called as a bold move from the institute administration in curbing such political influence on the mindset of the student populace of IIT Kharagpur, the Dean of Students' Affairs has circulated a mail discouraging any such events which are organized with hidden political motives. He reiterated that tagging the name of IIT Kharagpur in such events which may escalate tension in society in the name of political affiliation, religion, caste and region can not be tolerated. Although he did not mention the extent to which the institute would be considering the severity of political motive, but the statement does send out a message regarding the degree of seriousness with which such detracting events are being taken into consideration by administration. Here is what the mail reads:
'It is being observed that some groups with political motivation are organizing some events in IIT Kharagpur but tagging the name of IIT Kharagpur. This is to inform you that such events are completely illegal and have no sanction of institute authority. IIT Kharagpur is an institution of national importance and we do not encourage any activity which escalates tensions in the society in the name of political affiliation, religion, caste and region. Our sole aim is to promote development of science and technology and nationalistic fervour among students.
We expect that students of IIT Kharagpur will not participate in any such event.'

short_message: A mother can be best described as someone who takes place of all others but whose place no one else can take. A mother's love is a miracle that never ceases
message:
A mother can be best described as someone who takes place of all others but whose place no one else can take. A mother's love is a miracle that never ceases to be miraculous from the very day we are born. She always stands with open arms when we need a hug. Her heart always understands when we need a friend. She stands with stern eyes when we need a lesson. Her strength and love always guide us all parts of life.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone Happy Mothers' Day.

short_message: If you are feeling stressed but don’t know the right way to become stress-free, then this is the app coming to help you- ‘DhyanAndroid’. It consists of
message:
If you are feeling stressed but don’t know the right way to become stress-free, then this is the app coming to help you- ‘DhyanAndroid’. It consists of self-evaluation of stress levels through user feedback and instructive meditation for emotional stability. It is a first-of-its-kind app which not only assesses the cognitive performance, emotional intensity and aggression level but also creates a virtual simulation of a meditation room through thermal imaging and vibrations. Developed by Professor Aurobinda Routray, Department of Electrical Engineering, along with a team of researchers from IIT Kharagpur, the Android and iPhone variants of the app will be launched by June 10.
According to the developers, this app will help users become emotionally stable and bring depression under control.

Source: https://www.gadgetsnow.co...

short_message: “Where the mind is without fear” are the lines which portrayed the true meaning of freedom and independence to colonial India under the British Raj and
message:
“Where the mind is without fear” are the lines which portrayed the true meaning of freedom and independence to colonial India under the British Raj and continue to inspire us to move forward in the direction of free thoughts, rational thinking, and ‘tireless striving’ towards our goals. The poem is a part of the Nobel winning work ‘Gitanjali’, a collection of poems, by Rabindranath Tagore.
Rabindranath Tagore was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in the year 1913 becoming the first Asian to be honoured with the Nobel. Along with being a renowned poet, he was also a writer, novelist, visual artist, composer, playwright, and a philosopher. His works influenced a wide range of Indians during the freedom struggle. Such was the impact of his works that two of his compositions were chosen by India and Bangladesh as their National Anthems. Tagore always stayed away from the concept of separatist nationalism and urged the people to get over the narrow differences of casteism and other social evils.
On his 157th birth anniversary, paying tribute to the revolutionary thinker, we hope that his ideas of freedom will be realised deeply as our nation progresses.

short_message:
Charles Dickens once said, “There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humour.”
Through humour, you can soften
message:
Charles Dickens once said, “There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humour.”
Through humour, you can soften some of the worst blows that life delivers. And once you find laughter, no matter how painful your situation might be, you can survive. On the occasion of World Laughter Day, let us laugh and make others laugh. Let us happily face every moment in our life, emerge out as an ecstatic person and make the world a better place to live in.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a wonderful Laughter Day!

short_message: The morning of the 5th of May, 2018 witnessed what may be called a giant step towards progress - the service of Ola Pedal has been inaugurated in the campus.
message:
The morning of the 5th of May, 2018 witnessed what may be called a giant step towards progress - the service of Ola Pedal has been inaugurated in the campus. The service was flagged the green signal by the Institute in the presence of the Director, Prof. Partha P Chakrabarti, the Dean of Students' Affairs, Prof. Somesh Kumar, the President, Technology Students' Gymkhana, Prof. William Mohanty and Vice President for the session 2017-18, Technology Students' Gymkhana, Mr. Mayank Srivastava, following which the group enjoyed a 2.2 ride.

The Ola Pedal Service would have maintenance on a regular basis by the technicians of the company. The 'end ride' option would be followed by a rating and feedback form where the rider can lodge complaints regarding the cycles or the service. Thereafter, the particular Pedal would be inactive for a period of 24 hours for maintenance displaying a message that the Pedal isn't available if anyone tries to book it during that period.
Even though the maintenance would be ensured by the technicians at Ola, being the prime stakeholders in this Institute and all the property that belongs to it, it is our duty to help and maintain these resources and prevent their vandalism, as our own responsibility. The sustenance of these resources would be crucial for the benefit of the entire IIT KGP community and we, as the members, should ensure it. It is up to us whether we can help this system grow or be demolished at the hands of our ignorance and irresponsibility. It is who makes the system and it is us who destroys it too.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur believes that the IIT KGP community is responsible enough to understand and feel the importance of the service and would be ready to extend their help in sustaining the service and all the others, yet to arrive. Let us make the campus a better place to live in and a better, yet, in the eyes of the world.
Image Credits: Click Kgp

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
short_message: The beautiful campus of IIT Kharagpur is waiting for you with a slight twist in its flavour. No need, now, to be afoot and toil in the scorching sun or
message:
The beautiful campus of IIT Kharagpur is waiting for you with a slight twist in its flavour. No need, now, to be afoot and toil in the scorching sun or get drained in the rainwater to reach your destination inside the campus. Ola Pedal is here and this has been made possible due to the great efforts of the Technology Students' Gymkhana. Now you can pick up a cycle from any of the Ola Parking Zones, majorly in the Halls of Residence, Main Building, Vikramshila and Nalanda. Using the cycles would cost you INR 5/- for the period of 15 minutes exclusive of taxes and would amount to about INR 6/- for the period including them. Just download the regular Ola Mobile App and you can book the ride, cashless and hassle-free. Enter the number below the QR code at the rear mudguard or the lock module of the cycle with the App and your cycle unlocks, ready to give your hair, the sway in the cool breeze of Kharagpur. The Ola Parking Zones are the only spots where the ride can begin or end. You can lock or unlock the cycle at any place other than these zones but the ride will continue to be chargeable in that case. The cycles cannot be taken outside the campus.

The cycles have adjustable seats, tubeless tyres, anti-slip chains and anti-rust alloy rims that make them effective to use.

The inauguration ceremony for the service will be held on 5th May 2018 from 10.30 AM. Also, it must be noted that only a few out of the forty locations will be active until July. The department locations will be active from July. More locations where the cycles would be stationed might be targetted in the future and it is when our campus would truly become easily accessible to everybody.

Detailed features and functioning of the facility and the list of the Ola Parking Zones will follow soon.
With this hope and full appreciation to the efforts and success of Mr. Seemant Jay and the Technology Students' Gymkhana, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone happy, safe and easy rides from anywhere to anywhere on this beautiful campus.

message:

short_message: With profound grief and deep sorrow, we inform you all the sad demise of our beloved student Veeral Sheth in an unfortunate road accident yesterday morning.
message:
With profound grief and deep sorrow, we inform you all the sad demise of our beloved student Veeral Sheth in an unfortunate road accident yesterday morning. He was a third-year undergraduate student of the Department of Biotechnology and a boarder of the Rajendra Prasad (RP) Hall of Residence.
He served as Sponsorship and Marketing Head and then as Core Team Head in the Spring Fest team, IIT Kharagpur. Always bubbling with spirit and full of enthusiasm, he was an amiable, kind-hearted and a gem of a person.
This is an irreparable loss for the entire KGP community. May God grant enough strength to his friends and family to bear this great loss. We all pray for the peace of the departed soul.

short_message: In an extremely unfortunate incident that folded out today,  Veeral Sheth, a third-year undergraduate student of the Department of Biotechnology and a
message:
In an extremely unfortunate incident that folded out today, Veeral Sheth, a third-year undergraduate student of the Department of Biotechnology and a boarder of the Rajendra Prasad (RP) Hall of Residence met with an accident today morning. After the end semester examinations, he was spending time with his family in Valsad, Gujrat before leaving for his summer internship. He was riding his bike, which he adored when this happened and he succumbed to the injuries.

Veeral served as the Core Team Head in the Spring Fest team, IIT Kharagpur. An avid follower of Chelsea football club and extremely fun-loving, Veeral was a gem one could have as a friend.

This indeed is a great loss for the entire Kgp community. May God grant enough strength to his friends and family to bear this irreplaceable loss. We pray for the peace of the departed soul.

short_message: In an initiative to strengthen the health and medical facilities on the campus, the IITKGP Foundation US has donated a high tech ambulance to IIT Kharagpur.
message:
In an initiative to strengthen the health and medical facilities on the campus, the IITKGP Foundation US has donated a high tech ambulance to IIT Kharagpur.
The medical equipments include transport ventilator, defibrillator, syringe pump, suction pump, fully regulated oxygen supply system for patients, patient monitor for BP, ECG, oxygen saturation in blood, respiratory rate, pulse rate and a foldable stretcher trolley for comfortable transfer of the patient to and fro the ambulance. The ambulance has dedicated batteries and alternators for uninterrupted power supply and air-conditioning one for the patient cabin irrespective of the engine function.

http://www.millenniumpost...

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.
short_message:
The Scholars' Avenue shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.

Kgp is a magic ride for all of us. It is a mixed bag of happiness, despair,
message:
The Scholars' Avenue shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.

Kgp is a magic ride for all of us. It is a mixed bag of happiness, despair, and wonders. It has never failed to Stupefy all those who have set foot here and we hope this journey has been as fantastic as Alice’s adventures down the Rabbit Hole, as magical as Harry’s stay at Hogwarts and as adventurous as Bilbo’s quest for the ring that ‘rules them all’ for the entire graduating batch. With this journey slowly coming to its end for the Class of 2018, we’d like to fill up your treasure trove of memories with the best moments of your college life. So all the Harrys, Rons and Hermiones out there, dress up as anyone and anything you like on the 28th of April and grace the Bidhan Chowk with your presence from 4:30 PM onwards. Be a superhero from the Marvel Universe or a God from Mythology or simply a Holiday Armadillo. Anything or anyone.

P.S.: Be ready to sway to the beats of the Class Song of 2018 ❤️

short_message: A room in the top floor of D block in Radhakrishnan Hall caught fire and was severely damaged. The exact cause is not known but we are suspecting an appliance
message:
A room in the top floor of D block in Radhakrishnan Hall caught fire and was severely damaged. The exact cause is not known but we are suspecting an appliance breakdown or a short circuit. Fortunately, no one was injured as the room was locked.

We request all the students and members of the institute to stay careful and keep a check on their electrical appliances. Cases of short circuit are highly probable considering the current weather conditions, hence consider this as a gentle reminder and a warning issued in public interest.

short_message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Final Standings

This edition of General Championship saw spectacular participation from various halls of residence
message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Final Standings

This edition of General Championship saw spectacular participation from various halls of residence in an extravaganza of various sports, cultural and technology events. The zeal and enthusiasm of the participants were striking during the events and so was during the award ceremony held on April 13, 2018, in the Kalidas Auditorium. Though each and every hall tried the best of them, a handful of them excelled and received the much-desired trophies and cups in an aura filled with the tempo-shouts and bliss.

The final standings of each General Championship are as follows:

||General Championship Social & Cultural||

The battle for the trophy went up to the last event and the competition between RK and Patel ultimately ended up in favour of RK. Both RK and Patel conquered over the cups in 4 categories.
1. RK (913.3 Points)
2. Patel (888.3 Points)
3. Azad (545 Points)

Dramatics Cup - RK
Fine-arts Cup - RK
Entertainment Cup - Patel
Literary Cup - Patel

||General Championship Sports & Games||
1. Azad (70 Points)
2. MMM (42 Points)
3. LBS (36 Points)

||General Championship Technology||
1. LBS (420 Points)
2. Azad (335 Points)
3. RP (330 Points)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and appreciates the participants for putting their efforts. For further details and event wise points distribution, follow the link: http://awaaziitkgp.org/GC...

short_message: Recently, one of our fellow students, Mr. Nanda Kishore, a fifth-year student from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering
message:
Recently, one of our fellow students, Mr. Nanda Kishore, a fifth-year student from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering succumbed to a multiorgan failure in a hospital in Kolkata. The sad demise took place owing to tuberculosis which was identified during his operation of appendicitis there. Though the first operation was successful, he could not recover and died after continuously struggling for 21 days.

The Senate along with the faculty members from Administration, being concerned about the poor financially state of his family, have decided to raise a fund of INR 300000 including the expenses for his treatment to help them sustain for a year and find a stable option with time.

Here is the link to the fundraiser for Mr. Nanda Kishore: https://www.ketto.org/fun...

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges the students’ community to help the family of Mr. Nanda Kishore to the best of their capability and prays for the departed soul to rest in peace.

message:
Time and again KGPians have showcased their brilliance in the entertainment industry and this time it is the National Film Awards where their talent has been rewarded.

A non-feature film titled 'The Unreserved', made by two of our alumni, Ashay Gangwar and Samarth Mahajan, has been awarded the National Film Award for the year 2017 for best On-Location sound recordist.

This is a moment of pride for the KGP student community and simultaneously highlights how hard work when coupled with passion, leads to unprecedented results.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur with Department of Physics, IIT Kharagpur.
short_message:
||New Course on Functional Materials & Devices||

Department of Physics, IIT Kharagpur commences a new course namely ‘M.Tech. in Functional
message:
||New Course on Functional Materials & Devices||

Department of Physics, IIT Kharagpur commences a new course namely ‘M.Tech. in Functional Materials & Devices’ which replaces the earlier Solid State Technology (M.Tech.) course from the very next academic session.

The newly introduced course structure comprising of a good range of interdisciplinary courses from Dept. of E & ECE, Materials Science Centre, etc. aims to produce a better workforce which can tackle the modern challenges in industries. Apart from the elemental constituents, courses on Computational Methods, Science & Technology of Nanomaterials and Advanced Experiments in Solid State Technology are also included in the curriculum.

With a total of 25 seats, applications are invited from the students of Applied Electronics & Instrumentation, Applied Electronics Engg., Electronic Instrumentation & Control, Electrical & Electronics Engg., Electronics Engg.- Design & Manufacturing, Engineering Physics, Physics/Applied Physics and Material Science & Engineering.

The applicants with following qualifying degree can apply for the same:
1. B.E./B.Tech. or Equivalent
2. M.Sc. (With Mathematics both at +2 and B.Sc. level)
The deadline for online application for submission is April 18, 2018 (Wednesday).

Interested students may follow the link below for the application: http://gate.iitkgp.ac.in/jmp/?id=
More information can be gathered right from the Admission Brochure 2018: http://gate.iitkgp.ac.in/...

short_message: It has come to our notice that the marking scheme in the Inter Hall Hardware Modeling event did not occur as per the standards set by the Tech GC rulebook.
message:
It has come to our notice that the marking scheme in the Inter Hall Hardware Modeling event did not occur as per the standards set by the Tech GC rulebook.
According to the official rules, the median normalization must be applied to the total scores of each judge following which the now normalized scores of every judge are added to obtain the final standings. However, the General Secretary's calculations led to the normalization of each individual parameter of every judge, which then resulted in incorrect standings.

A few students have mailed Prof William K Mohanty requesting that he consider their case and have the renormalized scores as per the official rules decide the final results. We hope that the final ruling abides by the norms.

With the gymkhana awards being scheduled to be presented today, even though logistical issues are posing a hindrance to a correction in the judgement, we wanted to let everyone be aware of the problem. We have also attached herewith the link to the spreadsheets with the original and renormalized scores. Stay tuned for further updates.

The original scores can be found in this link:
https://docs.google.com/s...

The correctly renormalized scores can be found in this link:
https://docs.google.com/s...

short_message: In what can be termed as a historic event for alumni-generated funding of IITs, Shion Deysarkar, CEO of Datafiniti and son of US-based entrepreneurs and
message:
In what can be termed as a historic event for alumni-generated funding of IITs, Shion Deysarkar, CEO of Datafiniti and son of US-based entrepreneurs and IIT Kharagpur’s alumni Dr. Asoke Deysarkar and Dr. Ruma Acharya Deysarkar, has donated a whopping sum of 2 crores to his parents’ alma mater in what is a first of its kind instance.

A MoU has been signed regarding the funds and it will be utilized towards setting up three Chair Professorships in the domains of Geology & Geophysics, Chemical Engineering and Chemistry/Mining Engineering at IIT KGP’s Asoke Deysarkar and Ruma Acharya Centre of Excellence in Petroleum Engineering.

Shion Deysarkar, who is American by birth and upbringing and a data scientist from Carnegie Mellon University, says that this is an opportunity for him to help his parents continue their work at IIT-KGP and also finds it as an interesting way to merge Indian and American academic cultures to create mutual beneficiaries.

The director Prof. Partha Pratim Chakrabarti and the recently appointed Dean of Alumni affairs Prof. Subrata Chattopadhyay warmly welcomed this move and reckoned that this amount would not only be of great importance for IIT Kharagpur to maintain its legacy in several initiatives but also prove to be an ice-breaker for Alumni progeny to associate themselves with the culture of contributing to the IIT ecosystem.

Source: https://economictimes.ind...

short_message: Our fellow KGPians have now and again made the country proud with their innovative ideas being showcased at the best of the platforms in the world. This
message:
Our fellow KGPians have now and again made the country proud with their innovative ideas being showcased at the best of the platforms in the world. This time, it’s the Team Infinity from IIT Kharagpur which bagged the third prize in the Innovation Summit Bold Ideas Competition at Paris organized by Schneider Electric, one of the biggest players in the field of renewable energy. The team consisting of Nawazish Parwez, Nihal Gupta, Soumya Dubey, Akash Kumar and Gaurav Kumar (right to left in photograph) performed exceptionally well in the first round of the competition that saw a participation of more than 240 teams from 40+ countries all around the world to secure a place among the top 10 teams to showcase their talent in the summit to be held in Paris. Their idea was based on the hybrid solar panel which increases the efficiency of the existing conventional system, using the modern principles of Materials and Environmental Engineering. The idea was appreciated by the judging panel consisting of environmentalists and scientists all around the globe.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all of them for bringing laurels to the institute and encourages the student community to participate in such competitions.

short_message: A soon-to-be-published book 'Groundwater of South Asia' edited by an IIT Kharagpur Associate Professor, Prof. Abhijit Mukherjee, suggests setting up of
message:
A soon-to-be-published book 'Groundwater of South Asia' edited by an IIT Kharagpur Associate Professor, Prof. Abhijit Mukherjee, suggests setting up of a “Groundwater mission” which would help to tackle the problems associated with hydraulic dissipation in the South-Asian region, mainly comprising arsenic and fluoride pollution and storage anomaly.

Attached to the Department of Geology & Geophysics in the institute's School of Environmental Science and Engineering, Prof. Mukherjee has worked in different parts of South Asia, looking at groundwater issues for almost two decades.

It is noteworthy that despite being the fruit-bearer of three large water systems, almost half the water that enters the South Asian hydrologic system is dissipated by poorly understood and quantified processes. Although there have been several projects to accelerate and improve the drinking water supply in India, such as “Rajeev Gandhi Drinking Water Mission” and “National Rural Drinking Water Programme”, Prof. Mukherjee’s book recommends that there is a dire need of a groundwater mission on similar lines.

Source: http://www.business-stand...

short_message: Around a month ago, most of us witnessed some great effort put in by few halls in the Inter-Hall Gardening competition and the fresh pictures of lovely
message:
Around a month ago, most of us witnessed some great effort put in by few halls in the Inter-Hall Gardening competition and the fresh pictures of lovely gardens were enthusiastically shared. Unfortunately, or rather habitually, the gardens haven’t taken long to topple off the peak. Given that lot of effort by Hall staffs and considerable money (as high as Rs. 50,000) goes into preparation for this competition, we must ponder over the meaningfulness of this competition and alter our approach to the maintenance of Hall gardens.

short_message: West Bengal has always been rich in culture and heritage, also due to the British rule of East India Company establishing its roots in India through Kolkata.
message:
West Bengal has always been rich in culture and heritage, also due to the British rule of East India Company establishing its roots in India through Kolkata. But we have lost our culture, haven’t we? If not fully, then to a great extent.

The Department of Humanities and Social Sciences of IIT Kharagpur is teaming up with the University of Liverpool, UK to aid conservation efforts in the state of West Bengal and help in protecting the cultural heritage of cities and towns along the course of Hooghly river. The places where the project will focus are Bandel, Chinsurah, Chandannagar, Serampore, and Barrackpore which are former trading posts and garrison settlements along the Hooghly. The project is being jointly funded by the Arts and Humanities Research Council, UK and the Indian Council for Historical Research.

Source- http://indianexpress.com/...

short_message: Those innocent children from Nursery and LKG classes took everyone in Kalidas auditorium back to their childhood when they danced, albeit without much
message:
Those innocent children from Nursery and LKG classes took everyone in Kalidas auditorium back to their childhood when they danced, albeit without much appreciable coordination among themselves, but this is what makes them children and brought a smile on everybody's face. Gopali Youth Welfare Society celebrated 'Aashayein', the tenth annual day of Jagriti Vidya Mandir, a school run by the society which has lighted the lives of 200 underprivileged children, on 7th April. Professor Somesh Kumar, Dean of Student Affairs graced the occasion as the chief guest and Prof. Mrigank Sharad, Dept. of Electronics & Electrical Communication Engineering, Prof. Seema Singh, Dept. of Humanities and Social Sciences and Mr. Mrinal Kanti Bhanja, Founder and President of Gopali Youth Welfare Society graced the function as guests of honour and praised the members of GYWS for their selfless work.
To know more about the Gopali Youth Welfare Society, please visit: http://awaaziitkgp.org/gy...
