story: The Scholars' Avenue added 33 new photos — with Manorama Jha and 5 others.
short_message: Safety Analytics and Virtual Reality lab in the Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering invited The Scholars' Avenue to showcase their work and
message:
Safety Analytics and Virtual Reality lab in the Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering invited The Scholars' Avenue to showcase their work and projects. Established in May 2016 under the mentorship of the Prof Partha P Chakrabarti, Director IIT Kharagpur, and under the charge of Prof Jhareswar Maiti, Head of Department, Industrial and Systems Engineering, the SAVR Lab has state of the art facilities to carry out research in Virtual Reality. The lab is equipped with the essential tools such as 3D laser scanners, military-grade head-mounted displays, oculus rifts, data gloves, powerful computers, projectors etc. The lab has been sponsored by the Government of India under the Uchhatar Avishkar Yojana (UAY) to promote Virtual Reality research.

Their “hero project”, for all the Elon Musk fans out there, is a Virtual Reality [VR] simulation of SpaceX’s Star-man created by Prateek Srivastava [Third-year undergraduate, Department of Ocean Engineering and Naval Architecture].

A team of 10 students including Manorama Jha[research scholar] and Siddharth Jindal [Third-year undergraduate, Department of Mathematics and Computing] led by Prateek and mentored by Mr. Anirban Santara [PhD scholar and a 2015 B.Tech graduate, Department of Electronics and Electrical Communications Engineering], who is popular in the Artificial Intelligence community of Kharagpur, are working on the Virtual KGP project, a complete open-source VR simulation of the campus which they hope will help in initiating other projects for development of different VR applications. To aid the completion of the project they intend to organize various hackathons where students will be awarded for adding intricate details. They aim to collaborate with the Urban Planning Department of IIT Kharagpur in making an app which will help regional planners visualize their designs. With Autonomous Ground Vehicle, IIT Kharagpur they plan to create a highly accurate and photorealistic simulation of an autonomous car through an open sourced project- the first of its kind in the world.

The lab has also taken up a project sponsored by Tata Steel to simulate the Electric Overhead Travelling [EOT] Crane in the hope of reducing industrial accidents and improving safety standards. Recognising the scope for research in Virtual Reality in various sectors like education, industry, and entertainment, they are encouraging Virtual Reality research in the campus and are inviting B.Tech and M.Tech students to take up projects in their lab.

The lab invites students to come in small groups to catch a glimpse of their SpaceX's Star-man simulation.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 19 new photos.
short_message:
Won’t you enjoy playing a counter-strike kind of game which has its landscape based on the KGP campus? We all would love to, Right?
Absolutely breathtaking
message:
Won’t you enjoy playing a counter-strike kind of game which has its landscape based on the KGP campus? We all would love to, Right?
Absolutely breathtaking and exhilarating experience! Yes, that’s what our reporters got when they experienced the high definition Virtual Reality simulation of Kharagpur campus and 'StarMan' driving the Roadster in space, developed by Virtual Reality Laboratory at the Industrial and Systems Engineering, IIT Kharagpur!
They were able to gaze through the enormous space including Earth, Moon, Mars, Sun and asteroids - all through the eyes of the Starman peeking through his window. Seeing planets rotating, passing by and the car just managing to avoid asteroids on its way - witnessing all these sitting in a chair in a small room but feeling as if you were actually an astronaut floating in the space! Getting the same thrilling experience while navigating the entire campus in virtual reality was a visual treat. They were even able to visit Tikka, drink coffee and throw the cup into the dustbin - all through motion sensors and trackers.
Established and conceived in 2016 with the coordination of Partha P Chakrabarti (Director IIT Kharagpur), current Head of the Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering Jhareswar Maiti and professor at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering Pabitra Mitra, this Virtual Reality laboratory got functional from May, 2016. It boasts of state-of-art world-class hardware and software facilities for 3D modelling, projection, navigation and tracking.
While Prateek Srivastava has worked hard on the 'StarMan' project, other enthusiastic students are helping him out in the 'Virtual KGP' project which is going to be completed very soon. And the credit goes to their mentors Anirban Santara and Manorama Jha as well.
We often find out that most of us don't know about various research facilities available in the campus. This is an attempt to let the campus know about the exciting research opportunities that are available in this field of VR and simulation so that more enthusiastic students can join the team and carry forward the awesome work done by the current students.
There are many projects going on currently which include EOT crane accident modelling and simulation, Dumper accident modelling, Accident modelling for open reversible belt conveyor and Hospital fire safety modelling.
We are thankful to the Safety Analytics and Virtual Reality Laboratory for inviting us and demonstrating some mind-blowing simulations!

short_message: The first weekend of this month witnessed an influx of eminent personalities in the fields of business and entrepreneurial ventures thanks to the Global
message:
The first weekend of this month witnessed an influx of eminent personalities in the fields of business and entrepreneurial ventures thanks to the Global Entrepreneurship Summit organised by Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur. Among them, Mr.Gulzar Azad was one of the guest speakers invited to share his experiences. We thank them for giving us a chance to interact with him.

Mr. Azad is the present connectivity head of Google India. One look at his profile will speak of his rich experience of working in different kinds of environments and his steady rise. We were glad to have an exciting chat with him on various topics, mainly his iconic RailWire Project, the fruits of which can be seen in the form of free wifi not only here at the Kharagpur Railway Station but all over the country and his experience of working with Google with respect to the entrepreneurial and networking opportunities it opened up for him. He had a lot of interesting things to say on this front and much more.

Check out the link below to share some of his thoughts on several topics ranging from intrepreneurship, free Wi-Fi to how Google shaped him into what he is today.

short_message: 'You should surely seek motivation from whatever good others are doing, but never go for comparison as everybody's life is unique and true inspiration
message:
'You should surely seek motivation from whatever good others are doing, but never go for comparison as everybody's life is unique and true inspiration lies within the self.' These are the words of Mr. Gulzar Azad, Country Head of Connectivity, Google India as Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur got a chance to interact with him. He came to IIT Kharagpur as the chief guest for the opening ceremony of the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2018.

He drives Google's initiatives for Internet access and broadband in India. He joined Google India in 2006, with responsibility for launching a range of mobile products and partnerships including Search and Android in emerging markets.

In 2013, Gulzar began working on RailWire WiFi, a partnership initiative between Google and Indian Railways to bring high-speed public Internet access to millions of people visiting train stations across India.

short_message: RK Hall organized a farewell party for one the most beloved professors of our institute Prof. Navtej Singh this Saturday night. He joined our institute
message:
RK Hall organized a farewell party for one the most beloved professors of our institute Prof. Navtej Singh this Saturday night. He joined our institute as a professor in the Department of Aerospace Engineering in 1984 and since then he has been one of the most enterprising and enthusiastic faculties on campus, winning numerous best faculty awards and is popular across all the years for his unique way of teaching and empathetic nature towards students.
Before being a professor, Prof Singh has completed his bachelors in Aerospace engineering in 1975, masters in 1977 and Ph.D. in 1982, all three from IIT Kharagpur and has spent 46 years of his life dedicated to this institution. During his stay as a student in KGP, he was a boarder of RK Hall of Residence and enthusiastically participated in extra-curricular activities and was highly active on the social front, too. As a professor, he served as the warden of RK Hall for 7 years. To know more about him, you can read the following article by Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur http://awaaziitkgp.org/na... from our 'Know Your Professor' Series.
In his honor, RK Hall will bestow a new award to one of its boarders this year onwards as 'Shri Navtej Singh Trophy'.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes Professor Singh a blissful life after retirement.

short_message:
3rd place Play-off || Cricket || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

3rd place Play-off: RP vs NH (Nehru won by 12 runs)
message:
3rd place Play-off || Cricket || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

3rd place Play-off: RP vs NH (Nehru won by 12 runs)

The scores were as follow:
Nehru: 132/8 (20)
RP: 120/10 (19.2)

Batting first, Nehru kept losing wickets at regular intervals. But Arpit, with a contribution of 65 runs from 53 balls, held one end firmly and made sure that they reach a respectable total. Nehru managed 132 runs from their quota of 20 overs. Now it was RP's turn to chase but a poor start surely didn't help their cause. They tried to consolidate their position with a good 3rd wicket-partnership. But, then again losing wickets after regular intervals meant victory slipping away from their hand! Ultimately, they fell short by 12 runs resulting in Nehru's win.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the team for putting up a good fight and the winning team for securing the 3rd place!

short_message:
Finals || Cricket || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Final: MMM2 vs AZ (MMM2 won by 1 run in super over)

The scores
message:
Finals || Cricket || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Final: MMM2 vs AZ (MMM2 won by 1 run in super over)

The scores were as follow:
Azad- 96/7 (20 overs)
MMM2-96/8 (20 overs)

Super Over: MMM2- 9/1 Azad- 8/1

The cricket final between two extremely dominant sides of the tournament proved to be an absolute thriller. On a mildly sunny day, both the sides played their heart out and dished out a spectacle of a match, to an extent that a super over was needed to decide the winner.

Batting first, Azad's batsmen were kept pretty much in check by the bowlers of MMM yet they managed to score at a steady pace and reached a total of 96 runs. Chasing 97, MMM's batsmen were expected to make through easily but a relentless show by the bowlers from Azad applied brakes on the MMM line up as only three runs were scored in the twelve balls of the 15th and 16th over. At the end of 16 overs, the match looked quite in the balance as MMM needed to score 34 runs off the final 24 balls with 7 wickets in hand. However, MMM smacked a few boundaries in a row to come back into the game. Needing 8 off the final over, there were successive run-outs leading to three runs needed off the final ball. The batsmen scrambled for a double and tied the match at 96 runs.

The match went into the Super Over where MMM batting first, had scored only 1 run off the first three balls with one man down, just then 8 runs came off the next three giving Azad a challenging 10 runs to chase. Azad needed 4 off the final delivery but managed only a double. This meant heartbreak for Azad as they fell short by the narrowest of margins and MMM won the high-intensity final!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for giving their best and the winning team for becoming the champions!

short_message:
Finals || Basketball || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games
Final: NH vs LBS (72-65)

In a jam-packed basketball court, LBS
message:
Finals || Basketball || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games
Final: NH vs LBS (72-65)

In a jam-packed basketball court, LBS took on Nehru in what was anticipated to be an extremely competitive final. Rightly so, till the last minute game could have gone in anyone's favour! But it was Nehru who held their nerves and came out with flying colours securing a marginal 7 point win over their opponent. Though Nehru maintained the lead throughout but LBS were never out of the game. At the half-time scoreline read 28-34 in favour of Nehru. LBS played their heart out and tried their best to cut down the lead but were always left behind by small margins. Ultimately, Nehru won the final by 72-65.

Individual awards were as follow:-
Best Fresher- Apar Sharma (LBS)
Highest Scorer- Anurag Dhankhar (Nehru)
Best Player of the Tournament- Akash Rathi (Nehru)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for putting up a great show and the winning team for their extraordinary performance!

short_message:

Semi-final 1: AZ vs NH. (Azad won by 17 runs)
The scores are
message:
Semi-finals || Cricket || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Semi-final 1: AZ vs NH. (Azad won by 17 runs)
The scores are as follow:
Azad- 105/6 (20)
Nehru- 88/10 (19.5)

Azad batted first, riding on the back of 28 runs by Pratik and some steady contributions by the other batsmen, scored 105 runs in their quota of 20 overs. While the total looked modest, a rather slow start from Nehru's top order led to their downfall and the match quickly fell out of their grip thereafter. There was some resistance shown by Arpit who scored 34 before he was run out. Azad's bowlers, Ramsingh and Ankit, bagged three wickets each and were assisted by some terrific catches and runouts that led to a comfortable victory for their team. With this win, Azad advances to the finals!

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes them all the best for the finals!

short_message: IIT KGP and AIIMS to come together! 'IIT Kharagpur and AIIMS are planning some unique joint initiatives in academics and research that will open new directions
message:
IIT KGP and AIIMS to come together! 'IIT Kharagpur and AIIMS are planning some unique joint initiatives in academics and research that will open new directions in education and take technology-enabled healthcare directly to the people at large,' said Prof P P Chakrabarti, Director, IIT Kharagpur. Senior professors of both the institutions are in discussion to take the initiatives forward.The collaboration will include strengthening of ongoing activities through collaborative education programmes, research and collaboration for management and analysis of hospital data. Prof Randeep Guleria, Director, AIIMS Delhi, said the medical domain is becoming progressively technology intensive, which puts the matter of IIT Kharagpur providing medical and allied education in perspective.

Source- http://www.business-stand...

short_message:
Semi-finals || Basketball || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Semi-final 2: NH vs AZ (64-57)

In midst of a full house
message:
Semi-finals || Basketball || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games

Semi-final 2: NH vs AZ (64-57)

In midst of a full house basketball court, the second semifinal witnessed a neck to neck fight between Azad and Nehru. While the first quarter was equally fought and ended with Nehru leading 29-26, it was in the second quarter that Nehru asserted dominance by stretching the lead to 44-32. However, men from Azad were in no mood of bowing down and made a brave fightback in the last quarter reducing the lead to just 49-51, at one point of time. But Nehru held its nerves bringing out the best game under pressure and a flurry of baskets made the score 59-50 in their favour.

Holding on to the lead, the match ended on 64-57 with Nehru making way to what is expected to be a thriller final with LBS.

Also, Azad will be taking on Patel for the third-place playoff.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for putting up a brilliant show and wishes the winning team all the best for the finals!

message:
आप की राय
Recently, ‘Interaction Rooms’ were introduced by Technology Students’ Gymkhana in almost all the halls of residence. Interaction Rooms were introduced to provide the students a method to express their problems and issues to others. The concept mainly focussed on reducing the rates of depression in the campus and promoting student welfare. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur invites the general student community to present their opinions through the poll for this week: ‘Interaction Rooms’. The poll aims to spread awareness about the facility and understand the progress of these rooms.
Please follow the given link and cast your vote:
http://awaaziitkgp.org/po...

message:
'People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing. That's why we recommend it daily.'

Starting the Graph Theory for this semester with one of the most distinctive traits of our breed of engineers, a tradition rooted in the annals of history and followed ardently even today. May there be a time when the art of bathing, or not rather, becomes your badge of honour . Till then here's a something you can refer to.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared Institute Wellness Group,IIT Kharagpur's post.
short_message:
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared Institute Wellness Group,IIT Kharagpur's post.

Dear UG First year students!
Before you get into your
message:
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared Institute Wellness Group,IIT Kharagpur's post.

Dear UG First year students!
Before you get into your very crucial second year, we would like to remind you about your responsibilities and make you realize some forgotten and harsh facts which will help you in planning a proper career and successful stay at IIT KGP.
The UG Representative along with the Students' Welfare portfolio is organizing a compulsory sensitization program for all the freshers where in there will be valuable inputs from various deans, faculty and student representatives.
Please be on time and follow the seating pattern as shared with you by your EAA officer over mail.
See you all in Netaji at 6pm!

short_message: After series of tests at the CIC Lab, the Technology Transfer Group in association with the Sponsored Research and Industry Consultancy (SRIC) has officially
message:
After series of tests at the CIC Lab, the Technology Transfer Group in association with the Sponsored Research and Industry Consultancy (SRIC) has officially launched the Undergraduate Research Portal today at the Netaji Auditorium. Prof. S K Barai (Dean UGS) and Prof. Sriman Bhattacharya (Deputy Director) were present there along with few other Professors who gave an insight to the research fields and enumerated the research groups developed at IIT Kharagpur. The portal aims at promoting research among Undergrads, who can now apply for projects to work during their summer/ winter vacations. There was a demonstration in which a professor, Dumbledore floats a project topic of research, 'The Sorting Hat Algorithm.' Harry and Draco, the students, apply by filling the form through their student accounts in the portal and uploading a CV. Based on the applications, Draco gets rejected, and Harry selected who then starts to work on the project.
This initiative could tailor young minds towards research, thus bringing about a much-needed evolution in the research culture at IIT KGP.

short_message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Cricket
4th Quarter Finals Match: RP vs BRH

RP: 135/7 (20 Overs)
BRH: 133 /9 (20
message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Cricket
4th Quarter Finals Match: RP vs BRH

RP: 135/7 (20 Overs)
BRH: 133 /9 (20 Overs)
RP won the match and entered into semi-finals to play against MMM-2.
Earlier, BRH won the toss and chose to field first. RP scored a challenging enough 135 runs in the first innings.BRH players started very well and were in a complete mood of attack. But suddenly, 2 wickets fell in succession getting RP back into the game. The match was balanced throughout further and both the teams were performing well against each other. The last over of the match brought no less thrill to the show. BRH was in need of 10 runs with 2 wickets in hand. 5 runs were scored within the first two balls putting RP under pressure. Third delivery went dot and two singles came in another two balls. Finally, BRH was to score 3 runs in the last ball of the match. The last shot in desperate attempt went all in but was caught at the boundary and with this, RP advanced to the semis.

Here are the two matches to be held in semi-finals:
RP vs MMM2
Azad vs Nehru

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team wishes all the best to the players who will be playing in the semi-finals.

short_message:
Have you ever gone to ask for a project, but got your request declined because the professor was already too occupied?
Have you ever been in a situation
message:
Have you ever gone to ask for a project, but got your request declined because the professor was already too occupied?
Have you ever been in a situation in which you were asked to come up with a problem statement for the project, but you just couldn't do it?
Have you ever had an idea that you wished you could pursue as a project, but couldn't find that one suited professor?
UG Portal is the perfect platform to apply and plan for projects. The launch is planned on 6th February at Netaji Auditorium from 7:15 pm onwards. Be there to witness the unveiling of a platform that will revolutionize the research culture in the campus.

short_message: A recent notice of an office order banning the sales/consumption/distribution of any form of tobacco products in the institute ( <a href='https://www.facebook.com/awaaziitkgp/photos/a.146211918732505.22874.146188872068143/1728416217178726/?type=3&theater'
message:
A recent notice of an office order banning the sales/consumption/distribution of any form of tobacco products in the institute ( https://www.facebook.com/... ) created a wave among the students of the campus. A few days have passed since then, but there does not seem to be a change in the conditions even now.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur invites articles from the general student body under the series of ‘Your Perspective’ for the topic ‘Relevance and Efficacy of Ban on Tobacco Products in the Institute’. Articles can be mailed to our email id: editor@awaaziitkgp.org. Articles may be submitted by next Sunday.
Use of any type of slang words is discouraged in the article.
Also, please provide your name, roll number and hall in the article. Articles, however, can be published anonymously if requested.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Priyansh Shah and Mihir Sampat.
short_message:
Quarter Finals | Cricket | General Championship 2017-18 | Sports and Games |

Quarter-final 3: NH vs JCB (20)

The third quarter-final
message:
Quarter Finals | Cricket | General Championship 2017-18 | Sports and Games |

Quarter-final 3: NH vs JCB (20)

The third quarter-final was just the match that we would like to pay for watching. JCB won the toss and elected to bat first. After putting a decent total of 138 runs, it was Nehru's turn to chase. The match was equally balanced till the last over when Nehru needed 8 runs off the final over. That was not all, Ramakrishna brought down the gap to 6 runs needed in two balls. But, Nehru's batsman Vishwanth Teja had some other ideas! He scored a boundary off the 5th ball and sprinted for a couple on the final ball to go past JCB's total of 138 runs defeating them by 5 wickets.

The scores were as follow:
JCB: 138/7 (20)
NH: 139/5 (20)
With this win, NH advances to the Semi-finals of Cricket. For further updates, stay tuned to our page.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning team and wishes them all the best for their upcoming match!

short_message:
||New Micro-Credit Course||
Ever wondered how will our world or country look like in terms of medical technology or healthcare services? What would
message:
||New Micro-Credit Course||
Ever wondered how will our world or country look like in terms of medical technology or healthcare services? What would be the role of emerging new technologies (e.g. ML/AI) in the development and transformation of the field? Are we ready for the upcoming challenges?
Get an opportunity to listen directly from Professor Michael Friebe, a Distinguished Lecturer of the IEEE EMBS. He is an active contributor to this field through his research works & entrepreneurial skills and specialises in diagnostic imaging & image-guided therapies.

Professor M. Friebe is offering a 1 credit (additional) course named “INNOVATION, DISRUPTION, AND EXPONENTIAL DEVELOPMENT IN MEDICAL TECHNOLOGIES”.
The interested students must apply for this course through ERP by today only. The registration portal along with the syllabus and schedule can be found here: ERP>Academic>Students>Micro-Credit Registration.

For any query, contact Prof. P. K. Dan (pkdan@see.iitkgp.ernet.in) or Dr. Bhaskar Bhowmick (bhaskar@see.iitkgp.ernet.in).

short_message:
Update on MCM Scholarship

A significant chunk of the student population of IIT Kharagpur receives the Merit-cum-means scholarship and this
message:
Update on MCM Scholarship

A significant chunk of the student population of IIT Kharagpur receives the Merit-cum-means scholarship and this year the recipients have not yet received their scholarship amount. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur had earlier reported the reason for the delay (See post- https://www.facebook.com/... ).

We found out that out of about 600 recipients, about 50-60 recipients have not updated their correct bank account details in the ERP despite several requests by the Institute, as a result of which, no one has yet received the MCM scholarship amount to their credit.

One of our Executive Editors had a thorough meeting with the Officiating Deputy Registrar, Mr. Sarbeswar Nayak, regarding the withholding of the scholarship amount of those who have already submitted their details. Those students are not at all supposed to suffer due to the irresponsible behaviour by some of the students. The meeting concluded with the Officiating Deputy Registrar giving assurance that the students who have successfully updated their details will receive the scholarship amount in their bank accounts very soon, as the transaction is under process.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appeals to the students who have not updated their details with the ERP, to update them as soon as possible, as it creates hurdles in such crucial processes.

short_message: Contributing to a child's smile is one of the noblest things to do! Don't you want to be one of the contributors? We all still crave for the feeling we
message:
Contributing to a child's smile is one of the noblest things to do! Don't you want to be one of the contributors? We all still crave for the feeling we got playing in our school playgrounds or the grounds near our house. The lessons learnt in these playgrounds cannot be taught in any classroom. The open ground removes all the boundaries from a child’s actions giving him the freedom to grow in all dimensions both mentally and physically. Apart from all these benefits let us not forget the unparalleled fun on the swings and slides!

Child Rights and You (CRY) IIT Kharagpur Chapter is collaborating with Anthill Creations, started by IIT KGP alumni, where they make playgrounds for children in a unique way by using cost-effective practices such as industrial waste and localized sourcing techniques. They want your support for building a playground for the children of Amlatoria School to ensure that all children have fun and excitement in their lives. Currently, the Amaltoria School does not have a playground. CRY and Anthill Playscapes hope to raise INR 1,25,000 for their motive to spread smiles and cheerfulness for children and make the world a better place for children.
Support them here:
https://anthillcreations....

short_message: In an effort to brighten up the lives of less fortunate children, the IIT Kharagpur chapter of CRY has joined forces with Anthill Playscapes, started by
message:
In an effort to brighten up the lives of less fortunate children, the IIT Kharagpur chapter of CRY has joined forces with Anthill Playscapes, started by an IIT KGP alumnus, which focuses on making playgrounds for children in a unique way by using cost-effective practices such as industrial waste and localized sourcing techniques.

The collaboration of CRY and Anthill wants to ensure that all the children have fun and excitement in their lives and therefore they are hoping to raise INR 1,25,000 to support the kids from the Amlatoria school, one of their adopted schools from a nearby village. They do not have a playground right now and the amount you donate will go in giving the children a playful and memorable childhood.

Please click the following link to donate and know more.

https://anthillcreations....

short_message: Another proud moment for all KGPians. Our Alumnus of 2011 batch, Mr. Siddartha Khastgir has been named in the Forbes 30 Under 30 Europe 2018- Industry
message:
Another proud moment for all KGPians. Our Alumnus of 2011 batch, Mr. Siddartha Khastgir has been named in the Forbes 30 Under 30 Europe 2018- Industry List for research contributions which have delivered impact to the automotive industry. Mr. Khastgir is currently a Ph.D. Researcher at the University of Warwick where his research is focused on developing new methods and knowledge necessary to test driverless cars to ensure their dependability and to make them commercially viable and is consequently accelerating their introduction. He is also a UK Representative to the ISO Technical Committee for developing international standards in the field of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) and Automated Driving (AD).
His passion for automobiles first came to notice when he founded TeamKART-Formula SAE Team of IIT Kharagpur, the first ever Formula Student/SAE project at IIT Kharagpur. Through his talent and dedication, he got the first breakthrough when he procured a funding of INR 1 million from the Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC) IIT Kharagpur. This was the largest funding ever by IIT for a student-led project. Mr. Khastgir has also been awarded the TechWorks Young Engineer Under 30 Award 2017. Through his hard work fuelled by the right amount of enthusiasm, he becomes an inspiration for the youth all over the country.
https://www.forbes.com/pr...

short_message: The KGPian Quizzers are absolutely on a roll! The team of Abhimanyu Bharade, Baibhab Pattnaik and Harsh Agarwal won the 'India Quiz' in the recently concluded
message:
The KGPian Quizzers are absolutely on a roll! The team of Abhimanyu Bharade, Baibhab Pattnaik and Harsh Agarwal won the 'India Quiz' in the recently concluded Nihilanth - the Annual Inter IIT-IIM Quiz championship. After registering a thunderous sweeping win in Inter IIT Cultural Meet, their juggernaut went on to register one more victory against a formidable team of IIM Ahmedabad. Last year, they had finished last in the finals of India Quiz but they made amends for the same in the 15th edition of Nihilanth, hosted by IIM Ahmedabad from January 25-28, 2018. What makes this win more special is that they got past over mighty IIM Ahmedabad team to finish at the top.
This championship featured over seven quizzes for the institutes to slug it out for the coveted championship with the active participation of 450+ students from over 39 contingents (19 IITs, 20 IIMs). As far as overall rankings are concerned, IIT Madras was looking all set to win the championship for record 5th time in a row but was denied by a late comeback by hosts IIM Ahmedabad. IIM Ahmedabad bagged the championship and IIT Kharagpur finished joint 6th ahead of IIM Lucknow, IIT Kanpur and IIM Bangalore.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the participants for their wonderful performance!

short_message: National Misson on Education through Communication and Information Technology (NMEICT), Ministry of Human Resource Development (MHRD) has awarded IIT Kharagpur
message:
National Misson on Education through Communication and Information Technology (NMEICT), Ministry of Human Resource Development (MHRD) has awarded IIT Kharagpur Phase-II of the project to develop a National Digital Library (NDLI). The project to develop a pilot for NDLI was also awarded to IIT Kharagpur which was completed well before the scheduled time. This is the primary reason why IIT Kharagpur was awarded the second phase. Visit https://ndl.iitkgp.ac.in / to register and have a look at the beta version of NDLI.

Phase-II of the project aims to develop the Pilot to a full-fledged NDLI with an aim to build a National Asset. This project will enable some key national knowledge discovery and immersive learning platforms built around the Digital Library. It will also encourage the entrepreneurial development of tools and apps around this platform. In its final contour, the system may serve as a pan-India virtual teaching-learning-evaluation-knowledge discovery and innovation platform, evolving as a key National Asset.

NDLI is getting structured along verticals like School, Competitive Exams and Career Development, Engineering, Medical, Law, etc. Under the Competitive Exams & Career Development vertical, NDLI is going to make available solutions (with explanations, alternate solutions, reference study materials and annotations) to all IIT-JEE Question Papers (since 2007) to benefit a large number of IIT-JEE aspirants.

The project is, thus, inviting applications from students who are currently in their 1st year of studies (Engineering, Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics) and are willing to work as part-time Intern to prepare Solutions for JEE Question Papers. Suitable financial compensation will be provided.
The selection for the internship will be made by the PI/Co-PIs of the project and will be based on academic records.

Interested students must submit their particulars at https://docs.google.com/s... .
The applications will be considered till 23:55 hours, Wednesday, 11th February 2018.

short_message: Heartiest congratulations to the three recipients of Honda Y-E-S Award 2017-2018 from IIT Kharagpur. The award was conferred to Mr. Piyush Nanda, Department
message:
Heartiest congratulations to the three recipients of Honda Y-E-S Award 2017-2018 from IIT Kharagpur. The award was conferred to Mr. Piyush Nanda, Department of Biotechnology, Ms. Bindu Sancheti, Department of Chemical Engineering and Mr. Ayan Majumder, Department of Mechanical Engineering on 25th January 2018 after a four-stage selection process. Every year, the award is conferred to 14 students across 6 IITs. The objective of the award is to felicitate meritorious students in the field of science and technology.
Each Y-E-S Award recipient received US$ 3,000 (US Dollar Three Thousand only) in equivalent Indian Rupees and a credit-granting summer internship program offered by a Japanese company or research institute for two and half months.
An additional of US$ 7,000 will be granted for pursuing the internship in Japan.
For further information, please visit the site:
http://yes.honda.co.in /
An introductory seminar will be conducted next semester for the same.

message:

सही और गलत के पार,

short_message:
“WE, THE PEOPLE OF INDIA, having solemnly resolved to constitute India into a SOVEREIGN SOCIALIST SECULAR DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC…”
It’s no one else but
message:
“WE, THE PEOPLE OF INDIA, having solemnly resolved to constitute India into a SOVEREIGN SOCIALIST SECULAR DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC…”
It’s no one else but us who had taken this pledge long ago to make our country a better place not only in terms of lawfulness but also to achieve the transcendental goal of peace & harmony in the community which India comprises of. Our constitution is just a path towards building a good republic and with our honest intentions, we can constitute a healthy republic. Let’s commemorate the efforts of the historic intellectuals of our land in bringing out our nation to this level and put our efforts to head towards a better tomorrow.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a Happy Republic Day!

short_message: ‌Amidst the energetic spring, IIT Kharagpur celebrated the 69th Republic Day with great enthusiasm and warmth in the Jnan Ghosh Stadium. The celebrations
message:
‌Amidst the energetic spring, IIT Kharagpur celebrated the 69th Republic Day with great enthusiasm and warmth in the Jnan Ghosh Stadium. The celebrations unfolded with our honourable Deputy Director Sriman Kumar Bhattacharyya hoisting the national flag followed by the national anthem sung in unison. The NCC wings marched thereafter along with NSS volunteers cheering up the celebrations. Professor S K Bhattacharyya also addressed the students and the guests in the programme. Kids from schools such as DAV, Kendriya Vidyalaya and Jagriti Vidya Mandir (JVM) depicted India's cultural diversity in their lovely performances. The programme also included a dance performance by students of Technology Dance Society (TDS) and a Nukkad Natak by students of Gopali Youth Welfare Society (GYWS).
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a warm Republic Day.

short_message: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur got a chance to interact with Dr. János Pach from Hungary. He came here to deliver a lecture on combinatorics in Kshitij 2018. Currently,
message:
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur got a chance to interact with Dr. János Pach from Hungary. He came here to deliver a lecture on combinatorics in Kshitij 2018. Currently, he is a Professor at Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences at New York University and EPFL Lausanne.
He has been awarded Alfréd Rényi Prize from the Hungarian Academy of Sciences and has also been elected as a fellow of the American Mathematical Society for his contributions to discrete and combinatorial geometry and to convexity and combinatorics.
Have a look at this to know more about one of the best Hungarian Mathematicians

short_message: Don't we all get agitated due to the baseless links that pop up while reading some important news? A team of post graduate students and faculty members
message:
Don't we all get agitated due to the baseless links that pop up while reading some important news? A team of post graduate students and faculty members from IIT Kharagpur seem to have finally found a solution for these clickbaits, that is, webpages with luring titles but irrelevant content. IIT-KGP's solution is a browser extension named 'Stop Clickbait' that can detect and block clickbaits with more than 90% accuracy. Following this up, they are working with Microsoft to assess the relevance of the revenue models of such advertisements.

The team has analysed linguistic patterns and complemented it with tracking news and twitter posts of different national and international media channels over several months to develop this extension which already has over a 2000 downloads.

Prof. Niloy Ganguly, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT Kharagpur says,
'Our primary aim is to offer a choice to the readers. If they like clickbaits, they are free to pursue them. If they don't like, our extension can come to the rescue.'

Read the complete article at:
https://m.economictimes.c...

short_message: Setting high benchmarks in the world of competitive coding, the team 'The Vindicators' that consists of three KGPians namely Pranjal Shankhdhar, Sandeep
message:
Setting high benchmarks in the world of competitive coding, the team 'The Vindicators' that consists of three KGPians namely Pranjal Shankhdhar, Sandeep Kumar Pani and Mayank Khetan, has qualified for the prestigious ACM-ICPC 2018 World Finals. They showcased immense coding prowess to come second in ACM ICPC Amritapuri Regionals where 255 teams were battling for a spot in the finals.
In world finals, there will be around 130 teams eyeing for the ultimate top honours. ACM-ICPC 2018 World Finals will be conducted on April 19, 2018 and will be hosted by Peking University and CYSCC: The Children and Youth Science Center of CAST (Beijing, China).

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire team and wishes them best for the finals!

short_message: IITs are well known as the premier institutes of the country for their work for the society. IIT Kharagpur proved the same yet again by boosting development
message:
IITs are well known as the premier institutes of the country for their work for the society. IIT Kharagpur proved the same yet again by boosting development of North-East through technological assistance. IIT Kharagpur has great capabilities in the Food Processing sector and has prepared the
ready-to-eat high energy food paste, which will be very beneficial for malnourished children between the age group of six months to six years.

The Agricultural and Food Engineering Department of IIT Kharagpur demonstrated the initiative of the development of technology and machinery for the production of ready-to-cook iron-fortified rice premix which is fully compatible with those of normal rice, catering to India's anemic population.
A patent has already been applied for producing rice from broken rice kernels using extrusion technology.
The Rural Technology Action Group (RuTAG) unit, led by Professor PB Singh Bhadoria of IIT Kharagpur will be the coordinating center for this mission of technologies for the North-East.

'We are now planning for high-end value-added products including those from turmeric, ginger, etc, in collaboration with BARC,'
IIT Kharagpur director Partha Pratim Chakrabarti said.
Source- http://www.millenniumpost...

short_message:
The fifteenth edition of Kshitij was inaugurated in Kalidas Auditorium last night.
The event began with the traditional lighting of the lamp, followed
message:
The fifteenth edition of Kshitij was inaugurated in Kalidas Auditorium last night.
The event began with the traditional lighting of the lamp, followed by the Director's welcome speech for all the participants, the guests of honour and the chief guest of the event, Mr. Kaushik Dutta, Joint General Manager of the title sponsors of Kshitij-2018, L&T Ltd.

Following the motivational words of the Director and Mr. Dutta for the excited participants, faculty member Prof. Jitendra Kumar delivered the vote of thanks to the guests and all the people who have burnt the midnight oil to make Kshitij a reality.

Dean of Student Affairs, Prof. Somesh Kumar introduced the audience to Dr. Rajendra Singh, who then delivered the introductory lecture. Dr. Rajendra Singh, who is a guest of honour for the event, is a water conservationist and is renowned as the Waterman of India.

short_message: IITians are well known for their innovative ideas which have always been helping the society. Mr. Prateek Sharma, an alumnus of IIT Delhi has proved the
message:
IITians are well known for their innovative ideas which have always been helping the society. Mr. Prateek Sharma, an alumnus of IIT Delhi has proved the same in a louder voice. The team of IIT alumni including Mr. Sharma, professors and other students have developed an anti-pollution filter which costs only Rs.10.
The motivation behind this unbelievably cheap product was his asthma-prone mother. She had to face suffocation with the mask and apart from solving this problem, Nasofilters also protects people against allergies. These innovators had also won the ‘Startup national Award’ for their product in May 2017. For more details, follow the link below:
https://fit.thequint.com/...

short_message: For last 3-4 years, it has been observed that the amount of MCM scholarship used to get credited to the students' bank accounts within the first week of
message:
For last 3-4 years, it has been observed that the amount of MCM scholarship used to get credited to the students' bank accounts within the first week of the semester. But it has been around 16 days since the commencement of this semester and the MCM scholarship amount hasn't been credited yet. When our team tried to dig this matter up, what we found was something that reveals the sheer negligence of some of the students. Around 50-60 students haven't updated their bank details (Account numbers and other information) and since the MCM scholarship is credited batch-wise at once, incomplete bank details of some students are the reason why the amount hasn't been credited yet.
These concerned students have been mailed and informed many times to update their bank details but to no avail! Due to some of the students, many students who used to pay their semester fees with the MCM scholarship money have not been able to register yet. Other students who are in dire need of financial assistance and MCM has been their only source for the same, are also facing difficulties of various degrees. As more details were revealed, it was found out that some students have also filled invalid contact numbers and account numbers (containing alphabets) such as MV34GK984P.
This kind of sheer negligence and carelessness on students' part is gross irresponsibility on students' part and goes on to show that how insensitive have they become towards abiding by the rules and regulations. And their negligence has affected not only them but also many of the needy students who would have liked to get the scholarship as soon as possible.
We would like to appeal to the student community to fill the necessary details as soon as possible. Also, we all should make efforts henceforth so that such kind of incidents do not get repeated in the future.

short_message: In a remarkable decision taken by the Senate on the recommendation of Undergraduate Programme Evaluation Committee, B.Tech. Project (BTP) has been made
message:
In a remarkable decision taken by the Senate on the recommendation of Undergraduate Programme Evaluation Committee, B.Tech. Project (BTP) has been made optional with effect from academic session 2018-19. In what is being hailed as one of the most impactful academic reforms in recent times, students have been given the freedom to take subjects of equivalent credits in place of BTP.
Also, a student can register for B.Tech. projects in other departments and such projects will be evaluated by the department where the student is pursuing the project. Students pursuing minors or micro-specialisations and research output of IIT Kharagpur - both are bound to get affected by this new provision. This decision is expected to take most of the students by surprise for sure and the academic landscape will see a probable drastic change from the next academic session.

NOTICE
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
On the recommendation of the Undergraduate Programme Evaluation Committee, the Senate at its 323rd meeting held on 22nd December 2017, approved the following revised rules/guidelines for B.Tech Project (BTP) with effect from Academic Session 2018-2019.

1) The B.Tech project will be optional. BTP-I will be of 3 credits and BTP-II will be of 6 credits.

2) Allotment of projects will be done once the list of students who opt for BTP will be available in the 6th semester.

3) If a student opted BTP-I in Autumn Semester, then the faculty supervisor should inform whether BTP-II is necessary in the Spring semester.

4) After Autumn Semester, the student will have two options:
I. The student can continue with BTP-II as an extension of
BTP-I in the Spring Semester, OR
II. The student will be allowed to take theory subjects of
equivalent credit in the Spring Semester in lieu of BTP-II, if
there is no condition attached by faculty supervisor at the
beginning.

5) A student who does not opt for BTP must take subjects of equivalent credit in both Autumn and Spring semesters.

6) A student can also register for B.Tech projects in other departments (with necessary approval of the Head of the Department in which he/she is originally enrolled, and the Head of the Department in which he/she wants to pursue B.Tech project), and in that case, the project will be evaluated by the department where the student is pursuing the project in both the semesters.

short_message: To promote classical arts among the present generation, an International Convention is going to be organized jointly by Spic Macay, IIT Kharagpur and Bengal
message:
To promote classical arts among the present generation, an International Convention is going to be organized jointly by Spic Macay, IIT Kharagpur and Bengal Chamber at our campus from June 3 to June 9. Apart from folk and puppetry performances by an estimated 250 artists, the Convention will include 15 concerts and two-three film screenings. The Convention aims to provide an opportunity to the young generation to understand the unique and diverse cultural heritage of India.

Source: http://www.financialexpre...

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Shyama Agrawal and Anurag Goyal.
short_message: The KGPians have created their profound impression for providing solutions to the social and technological challenges with their unmatched intellect and
message:
The KGPians have created their profound impression for providing solutions to the social and technological challenges with their unmatched intellect and here is another brick stone to this. The students from Prodex, IIT Kharagpur represented the institute in the ‘Innovation’ wing of the Intercontinental Multi-Genre Talent Hunt Competition - ‘Masterpiece 2017’ organized by Living Talent. The very first edition of this competition was held in Dubai where 75 teams from all over the world were selected to showcase their innovative and appealing projects in the semi-finals. The students from IIT Kharagpur presented their product model ‘Vibronot’ to control the symptoms of Parkinson's disease.
The product with the potential it carried, was not only shortlisted for the finals which included only total 15 teams but was also declared as one of the best solutions to the particular disorder. The product idea was aimed at facilitating the old age life by making the patients self-reliant for their day-to-day activities.
Living Talent is a Talent Hunt Company which aims to bring brilliant individuals from the globe under an umbrella to motivate and appreciate their talent in three different genres namely, Performance, Art & Craft and Innovation. ‘Masterpiece 2017’ was the first event of under their banner and more such events are to be organized annually. We hope KGPians will keep on repeating such performances and bring laurels to the institute.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Team Prodex for their earnest efforts followed by an excellent performance!

short_message: IIT Kharagpur conferred the first ever Learn-Earn-Return Fellow Award to 3 of its 1st-year students. The award was instituted by Prof P P Chakrabarti,
message:
IIT Kharagpur conferred the first ever Learn-Earn-Return Fellow Award to 3 of its 1st-year students. The award was instituted by Prof P P Chakrabarti, Director IIT Kharagpur, IIT Kharagpur, in July 2016 with the funding crowdsourced from the alumni. Jyoti Agrawal, Jyotisman Das and Rathin Singha from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering were the recipients. The fellow award was conferred on the occasion of the Annual Alumni Meet on January 13, 2018 in the presence of about 300 alumni who came from India and abroad.

Each of the students will receive Rs. 10000/- per month for 4 years as a cash award. At the end of the first semester of the 1st year, it will be awarded based on JEE Advanced rank. From second semester onward the recipients of the award would have to maintain a CGPA 9.

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the students and hopes these awards would bloom into a beautiful support system between our alumni and our students.

Read on to know more:
http://alumni.iitkgp.ac.i...

short_message: The 15th Annual Alumni meet has officially began! Day 1 of the three day event began with a campus tour followed by a departmental visit. A 'Musical Night'
message:
The 15th Annual Alumni meet has officially began! Day 1 of the three day event began with a campus tour followed by a departmental visit. A 'Musical Night' was organised in which the a few alumni of the '93 batch who had a band named 'Still Waters' took to the stage to perform some age old classics after a gap of 25 years. The performance was scintillating!

Approximately 300 alumni, from the batches of '68, '78, and '93, are enjoying their return back to campus.

One of the alumni who was also a part of the Springfest organising committee expressed his jubilation on coming back for the first time since graduation.
'A lot has changed. There are roads and pathways everywhere. Boys are definitely more disciplined than we were. I wish I could have those days back', he told The Scholars' Avenue.

Day 1 of the meet will come to an end with the much anticipated hall visits.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
short_message: Prof. Suman Chakraborty, Professor at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, Associate Dean (SRIC) and Head, School of Medical Science and Technology
message:
Prof. Suman Chakraborty, Professor at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, Associate Dean (SRIC) and Head, School of Medical Science and Technology has been conferred with the Fellowship of The Royal Society of Chemistry, United Kingdom. The Royal Society of Chemistry (RSC) is a learned society (founded in 1980) in the United Kingdom with the goal of 'advancing the chemical sciences'.

With this, Prof. Chakraborty has yet again made the whole institute proud. He joined the institute in 2002. He already has many awards and honours to his name including the highest scientific honour from the Government of India i.e., Shanti Swaroop Bhatnagar Prize (2013) and Scopus Young Scientist Award (2008). His research area includes Microfluidics and Nanofluidics, Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) etc. He has been the pioneer to agglomerate the science of microscale fluid mechanics with the complex biophysics of cells. He has also been the first researcher to develop a fundamental theory on the electrokinetic transport of blood through microfluidic conduits. He has about 340 research papers to his name, accepted by reputed journals.
Last year, in April, we had a talk with Prof. Chakraborty where he had discussed his journey, engineering, Ph.D., hobbies etc. Give it a read here: http://awaaziitkgp.org/su...

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him for this feat and wishes all the best for future endeavours!

.

message:
Have you ever known an entrepreneur who has devoted all her entrepreneurial skills to bring smiles on the faces of thousands of little kids? We are glad to present to you one such entrepreneur in the series of 'Know Your Entrepreneur'. This time, we interviewed Nancy Charaya (IIT Kharagpur, B.Arch. batch of 2015), the COO of Anthill Creations - a team of five passionate architecture graduates who have been working towards coming up with architectural solutions to emerging problems in society that includes constructing playgrounds and libraries for needy kids. It is one of the eight early-stage non-profit startups selected for an 18-month incubation programme by the NS Raghavan Centre for Entrepreneurial Learning (NSRCEL) at the prestigious Indian Institute of Management (IIM), Bangalore.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Swarnabha Roy and 21 others.
short_message: 3 Golds and 1 Silver in last four Inter IIT Technology Meets! Which team does that? No team does that unless it's IIT Kharagpur! The kind of legacy that
message:
3 Golds and 1 Silver in last four Inter IIT Technology Meets! Which team does that? No team does that unless it's IIT Kharagpur! The kind of legacy that IIT KGP has built over the years has earned them the tag of 'Tech Giants' among the IITs. The technical prowess seems to be in the culture of KGP that makes this back to back sweeping of medals and podiums in the tech meet look so effortless. But a lot goes into the background while preparing for the same. And that's why all the team members of Inter IIT Tech contingent deserve a thunderous applause.
The contingent captain Rishabh Shrivastava puts this victory into words, “I'm extremely proud of the contingent which performed astonishingly well to come on top among 19 IITs (highest number of IITs participating in any inter IIT Meet). A big shout-out to the tempo of the contingent which superseded the lack of resources provided to us and kept believing in themselves. We won by huge margins in the real-life problem statements that were put forward by different industries and such a high quality performance of KGPians is a clear indication of the fact that IIT KGP is way ahead in tackling real world issues.”
As General Secretary Technology (TSG), Anusha Sharan puts it by stating, 'Having received podium positions in the Inter IIT Tech Meet for the past four years with 3 Gold and 1 Silver, the Tech contingents have more than proved their mettle as compared to the other IITs. And it deserves a bit more spotlight in terms of resources and attention.'
Some participants do admit that things could have been bit better when it comes to timely and adequate allocation of resources. They felt that there was a bit inconvenience due to lack of timely and proper assistance that should have been ideally provided. All we can say for now is 'All is well that ends well'. We wish to see KGP reach to newer heights in the field of real life problem solving through its technical prowess and congratulate all the participants again for bringing laurels to the institution.

As General Secretary Technology (TSG), Anusha Sharan puts it by stating, 'Having received podium positions in the Inter IIT Tech Meet for the past four years with 3 Gold and 1 Silver, the Tech contingents have more than proved their mettle as compared to the other IITs. And it deserves a bit more spotlight in terms of resources and attention.'
Some participants do admit that things could have been bit better when it comes to timely and adequate allocation of resources. They felt that there was a bit inconvenience due to lack of timely and proper assistance that should have been ideally provided. All we can say for now is 'All is well that ends well'. We wish to see KGP reach to newer heights in the field of real life problem solving through its technical prowess and congratulate all the participants again for bringing laurels to the institution.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur once again congratulates the participants for their grand success!

short_message:
Inter IIT Technology Meet | IIT Kharagpur stamps their authority again in style
The stakes were bound to skyrocket when the finest brains of India
message:
Inter IIT Technology Meet | IIT Kharagpur stamps their authority again in style
The stakes were bound to skyrocket when the finest brains of India from 19 IITs came together to showcase their technical skills and win top honours in the Inter IIT Technology Meet that was hosted by IIT Madras from 5th to 7th January. Bigger the stage, better are the KGPians! They left no stone unturned to bring home the championship and finished with individual medals in 8 (6 Golds, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) of the total 10 events. With such a spectacular performance, they won the overall championship (Gold) with IIT Roorkee taking home the silver and hosts i.e., IIT Madras had to settle for bronze.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates each and every team member of the Inter IIT Technology Contingent along with the captain, General Secretaries, Professors and others who were directly or indirectly involved in taking the performance of the team to new heights.

short_message: IIT Kharagpur has joined hands with three Ivy League Universities of the United States for a geo-hydrological exploratory study of river Ganga at Varanasi.
message:
IIT Kharagpur has joined hands with three Ivy League Universities of the United States for a geo-hydrological exploratory study of river Ganga at Varanasi. Professor Partha Pratim Chakrabarti (Director, IIT Kharagpur) and Prof Rajeev Sangal (Director, IIT BHU) are the two key advisers of the water urbanism project. The project is part of the multi-focal point of research under the Science and Heritage Initiative (SandHI) spearheaded by IIT Kharagpur. A 50-member team of students, research scholars and academicians from three Ivy League US universities are collaborating with IIT Kharagpur.
Source: https://www.ndtv.com/educ...

short_message: IIT Kharagpur welcomes two new deans, Prof. Manoj Tiwari as the new Dean for Planning & Coordination and Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya as the Dean for Alumni
message:
IIT Kharagpur welcomes two new deans, Prof. Manoj Tiwari as the new Dean for Planning & Coordination and Prof. Baidurya Bhattacharya as the Dean for Alumni Affairs and International Relations.
Prof. Tiwari, a professor at the department of Industrial and Systems Engineering joined the institute in 2007 and have brought laurels to the institute with his extraordinary research, being rated 2nd among many researchers working in Logistics and Supply Chain Management in India and has many other achievements in his kitty that sets him apart.
Prof. Bhattacharya, who joined the Civil Engineering Department of the institute in 2006, is an associate faculty at the Centre for Theoretical Studies and was serving as the Associate Dean for Alumni Affairs and International Relations.
IIT Kharagpur is extremely grateful to Prof. Biswajit Mohanty and Prof. Siddhartha Mukhopadhyay, whose relentless services as former Dean P & C and Dean AA & IR helped the institute take long strides towards excellence.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the newly appointed deans, who assume office this semester onwards, a bright and fruitful tenure.

short_message: IIT Kharagpur and Tata Medical Center have signed a MoU through which they will soon enter into an institutional collaboration in education, research and
message:
IIT Kharagpur and Tata Medical Center have signed a MoU through which they will soon enter into an institutional collaboration in education, research and outreach programmes in the field of interdisciplinary medical research and technology. The primary objective is to promote collaborative research projects. Through MoU, it is planned to offer joint programs that will eventually lead to master's degree programs. The integrated M.Sc. - PhD is likely to focus in its first phase on medical physics, nuclear medicine and molecular medical microbiology. This would involve students spending at least one semester in each institute with joint supervision by faculty and scientists of both institutions. The degree will be awarded by IIT Kharagpur.

Source: https://timesofindia.indi...

short_message: In a first among the IITs, IIT Kharagpur will soon start certifying food items at its campus for their nutritional value and also check for adulteration.
message:
In a first among the IITs, IIT Kharagpur will soon start certifying food items at its campus for their nutritional value and also check for adulteration.
The Analytical Food Testing (AFT) Laboratory at IIT Kharagpur received the National Accreditation Board for Calibration and Testing Laboratories' (NABL) accreditation this month.The lab has the most sophisticated high-end equipment to check for adulteration and quality, and is at par with any international laboratory, according to Professor Rintu Banerjee, Department of Agricultural and Food Engineering and the in-charge of AFT Laboratory.
This is for the first time that any lab in any of the IITs or NITs has been given this accreditation, which has certified food testing in the laboratory.

Source: https://economictimes.ind...

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Priyanka Bhaskar and 6 others.
short_message:
| A tale of perseverance and resilience – rising above adversities to defeat the odds |
Do you know how a team of just 6 girls fought hard their way
message:
| A tale of perseverance and resilience – rising above adversities to defeat the odds |
Do you know how a team of just 6 girls fought hard their way to the title of Runner-up in a highly injury-prone sport? Do you know when was the last time KGP Women’s Basketball team had reached into the finals of Inter IIT Sports Meet? No, you might not be knowing! Let us tell you. It was 2004 and it’s after a gap of 13 years that these girls have repeated the same in style by winning the silver medal with an undefeated run till finals! But this journey has neither been a cakewalk nor they were served it easily on a platter. They upped their ante throughout the tournament and took it to another level when it mattered most.
In a fiercely contested contact sport which has high risks of players getting injured, the standard team size used to be 11 and the captain had requested for at least 10. But it was reduced to 9 since the administration felt that there is no need of those 2 extra players in a sport which didn’t have prospects of winning a medal. The Woes didn’t stop there. Out of 9 girls selected for the tournament, one of the most key players had to leave due to a medical emergency at her home. They lost their hopes for the tournament with their star player not being able to make it to the matches. Count goes to 8. One more player sustained an injury and couldn’t play. Count goes to 7. One player was in beginning stages and lacked in the experience that it takes to play at bigger stages. Effective count goes to 6. How do you play a sports tournament which requires 5 players and is highly injury prone? Justina Mathew, Ravali Madambakam, Silla Spandana, Saloni Kirdak, Swati Rawat and Remee Patel did the unthinkable! These six players played the entire tournament (5 matches) without having much luxury of getting substitutes. Out of these players, another key player had an injury in her thumb, which was later found to be a fragment fracture. But she didn't give up, she still took the risk and played all the matches. How about that for an example of perseverance? “A basketball team is like the five fingers on your hand. If you can get them all together, you have a fist.” And they proved so. They not only played, they also topped their pool and steamrolled opponent to reach all the way to finals with 4 wins out of 5 matches in their campaign. And along with winning hearts, they did manage to break the stereotype of basketball being the sport of only tall people. They did it all with good dribblers and long distance shooters.

In the first match itself, they were pitted against the hosts IIT Madras. Loud cheering, home supporters, taller players and what not! And guess what? They announced their arrival in style by beating the favourite hosts by 18-16. The team that no one was giving a chance to put up a fight has suddenly started looking threatening. As if that was not enough, their second successive win over IIT (ISM) Dhanbad by 15-8 sent a strong caution to the winds that they were here to stay, compete and win; not just to make up for the numbers. They gathered the momentum and their victory chariot didn’t stop there. In Quarter Finals, they comprehensively dribbled past IIT BHU by 23-19, sending shivers down the spine of opponents. It was an all-important Semi-Final clash with IIT Bombay. Stakes were high and odds were unfavourable but they rose to the occasion and delivered a nasty blow to Bombay’s hopes of going into Finals. It was tie neck to neck until the last moment when KGP got two free shots in the last 10 seconds of the match. The captain committed no mistake in firing them and the second one went in giving KGP a lead of one point. Can you believe that? A team which was being seen as the one participating just for formality and were no believers in them getting into knockout stages was into the finals! In the finals, they screamed, they ran ferociously, they dribbled hard, they threw all they had, they put each iota of energy their muscles could but credit to the opponents, they were simply better that day. As our players admitted, IIT Roorkee deserved the gold medal. Though they lost by 25-44, their entire campaign was studded with brilliant moments – the moments they can take pride on! It was nothing less than a roller coaster ride for them where they defied their own expectations and proved the pundits wrong. All the practice, hard work and perseverance bore sweet fruits.
It wasn’t their victory alone. It was also a big win for their coach Mr Soumen Mondal who played a pivotal role in motivating the team and strategizing for each match. He believed in them and always reminded them of their potential of getting a podium finish. As the players said, “Without his strategies, the victory wasn’t possible.” The never-say-die attitude of the team was all he wanted and girls didn’t disappoint him. The captain Remee marshalled her troop well and her leadership was the key to this entire campaign. A huge shout to these amazing girls!
What lies in the future? Most of the current players are graduating out. The team needs enthusiastic and dedicated junior players to fill the boots. As one of the players admitted, even during the practice sessions, participation from juniors was very less. They had a hard time choosing 9 players for the tournament. Participation from girls was utterly disappointing. And if that’s what will keep on going, we don’t stand a chance in rewriting histories in the upcoming Sports Meets. The current players have appealed to the girls to participate in as large numbers as possible. The sports scenario in KGP among girls isn’t in very good shape right now. We needed inspirations to look up to. Now that we have some of them, why to wait? Hit the ground on the very first day of the next semester!

short_message: Will IIT Kgp ever go cashless? Well, this is a big question and we agree that it requires a significant amount of time and effort to change the ongoing
message:
Will IIT Kgp ever go cashless? Well, this is a big question and we agree that it requires a significant amount of time and effort to change the ongoing system. Though not enough, the institute has made efforts regarding this.
During the winter break, a notice was circulated by HMC to every shop and canteen inside IIT to go cashless by 1st of January but as we can see the changes are next to nothing.
We had a small talk with one of the HMC representatives where we tried to find out the reasons behind its unsuccessful implementation.
Here is an excerpt from the talk.

message:
It’s a matter of pride for all of us that IIT Kharagpur’s team has bagged second position in 5th Inter IIT Technology Meet hosted by IIT Kanpur. In this battle of showcasing technological skills and competing with highly competitive teams from other IITs, IIT Kanpur bagged the first position while IIT Kharagpur and IIT Roorkee stood second and third respectively. With this result, IIT Kharagpur students have shown that they are one of the best when it comes to technology competitions. The standings of IITs are as follow:

short_message: Science is unsuccessful till the technology developed out of it fails to bring smiles to the common people. The ultra low cost activated laterite-based
message:
Science is unsuccessful till the technology developed out of it fails to bring smiles to the common people. The ultra low cost activated laterite-based Arsenic filter developed by Professor Sirshendu De, HOD, Department of Chemical Engineering was showcased at the Festival of Innovation organised by the Office of the President of the Republic of India at Rashtrapati Bhavan, New Delhi between March 4 to 10. The filter, a boon for over 5 million people of Eastern and North-Eastern India which are reported to have Arsenic contamination level above the permissible limit of 10 µg/L costs about Rs 4,000 and can treat 100 litres of water per day for five years with zero power and almost no maintenance. Meanwhile, the technology has been transferred to two companies and a patent has already been applied for.

Source: Press Information Bureau, Ministry of Information & Broadcasting, Government of India

short_message: Centre for Theoretical Studies is organising an academic seminar titled “Bribe And Punishment-A Quantitative Analysis of Harassment Bribery”. Professor
message:
Centre for Theoretical Studies is organising an academic seminar titled “Bribe And Punishment-A Quantitative Analysis of Harassment Bribery”. Professor Supratim Sengupta from Department of Physical Sciences, IISER Kolkata is to deliver the lecture discussing the role of Game Theory to analyse the social conflicts regarding the same and the profound consequences of bribery in the society.

Venue :- Gargi Auditorium, Vikramshila Complex
Schedule :- 16/03/2017(Thursday), 5 pm onwards

We urge the student community to show an active participantion in the event so that such people working in the domain of social welfare are motivated and appreciated to work on such interesting topics.

short_message: A month back, we published a GuestAve by an IIT Kharagpur Alumnus who had been involved in the starting and formalization of the Tech GC and how he perceived
message:
A month back, we published a GuestAve by an IIT Kharagpur Alumnus who had been involved in the starting and formalization of the Tech GC and how he perceived a disconnect in its structure with the world and the needs of 'Technology' in the industry, country and with the vision of IITs.

It garnered an amazing response from our readers with points and counter-points which prompted Dr. Aloke to present his own views on the topic and how he perceives the GC morphing into something that he considers a necessity for the India of tomorrow, in a transition from being just a 'Tech GC' to becoming a stepping stone for a career in 'Tech' that IIT originally claims to provide.

short_message: In what we can call a renovated move, institute's administration has decided to form students' council to take care of the issues related to academics
message: In what we can call a renovated move, institute's administration has decided to form students' council to take care of the issues related to academics and research. This move is going to significantly impact the interests of the student community at IIT KGP. Every department/Centre/School will nominate one student representative for each of these four categories - UG, PG, Research Scholar and Woman. These nominated representatives will go on to form four respective councils namely UG student council, PG student council, Research Scholars' student council and Women student council. One among the representatives will be identified as Vice Chairperson and he/she will be the representative of the council to the Senate. More information about the same has been attached below:

short_message: Technology Literary Society (TLS) conducted a poetry slam and open mic session on 10th March' 17. The event took place in F-232 in the evening and a beautiful
message:
Technology Literary Society (TLS) conducted a poetry slam and open mic session on 10th March' 17. The event took place in F-232 in the evening and a beautiful amalgamation of humour and sorrow, romance and wit and countless other emotions were witnessed as the participants recited their passionately written poems. The open mic went equally well and was a breath of fresh air taken by the people.

The Scholars'​ Avenue hopes that more sessions and events like these will be organised to give the budding poets and literati a new platform to showcase their talent and spread this vibrant culture.

The final of Football was held
message:
Sports GC 2016-17 || Inter Hall Football
Finals || AZ vs JCB

Result : AZ defeated JCB 2-1.

The final of Football was held today at Tata Sports Complex after being canceled yesterday due to rains. The ground was still wet, and many players slipped because of it.
Azad scored two goals early in the game and took a lead. JCB then scored a goal to make the score 2-1. Both teams created many opportunities in the second half but could not score.
AZ thus defended their title successfully.
The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners.

The Warwick Manufacturing Group (WMG) at the University of Warwick, founded by Indian-origin engineer-educator Kumar Bhattacharyya,
message:
Hello people,

The Warwick Manufacturing Group (WMG) at the University of Warwick, founded by Indian-origin engineer-educator Kumar Bhattacharyya, has been officially conferred the prestigious Regius Professorship, given by the British queen to recognise exceptionally high quality research.
Bhattacharyya, who is also a member of the House of Lords, is an alumnus of IIT Kharagpur.

Here is the full story.

http://www.hindustantimes...

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates him on this occasion.

short_message:
Hey everyone,

This just in today morning,The MHRD set up a three-member committee headed by IIT-Kharagpur Director Partha Pratim Chakraborty
message:
Hey everyone,

This just in today morning,The MHRD set up a three-member committee headed by IIT-Kharagpur Director Partha Pratim Chakraborty on Tuesday to suggest ways to reduce the number of seats falling vacant at IITs and NITs every year. The move comes in the wake of almost 3,000 seats falling vacant this year despite six rounds of joint counselling for the IITs, NITs and centrally funded technical institutions. Of these, 73 seats were lying vacant at the IITs and 1,518 at the NITs.

We are eager to see what the committee comes up with.

http://indianexpress.com/...
